674375644.name: Great place to replace prescription glasses if your vacationing in Bucerias
674375644.author: a TripAdvisor user
674375644.reviewBody: Had the unfortunate experience of losing my glasses while staying at the Decameron in Bucerias. The Bucerias facebook page recommended going to the optician in the Mega Commercial centre on the outskirts of Bucerias. Had an eye test and a replacement set of single vision glasses supplied within 24 hours. Note any other type of lens or a coating would take 10 days which was too long.\nVery happy with the service and the turnaround. Saved my holiday.\n

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

673620564.name: standard fare
673620564.author: a TripAdvisor user
673620564.reviewBody: a good local place to make a stop and get the basics: grocery, liquor/wine, books, toys, clothing, recreation, etc.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

672538519.name: like any big grocery store
672538519.author: a TripAdvisor user
672538519.reviewBody: This is a large retail outlet with groceries, clothes and furniture.  The mega store near the Pelicanos Grand was only a 5 minute walk.  Very reasonable prices and their bakery was super.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

670478162.name: Mega Visit
670478162.author: a TripAdvisor user
670478162.reviewBody: Good store, not a lot there if you are just spending a week in an all inclusive.  Likely a great stop for condo dwellers.  Basically a Mexican Walmart.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

666037195.name: Local shopping
666037195.author: a TripAdvisor user
666037195.reviewBody: We stayed at a nearby all-inclusive but went for a walk one day (to burn off breakfast Buffett). Opposite the highway is was easy to cross to at the traffic light. Shaded parking was available for vehicles with a reasonable number of spaces. The Mega was connected to a small mall with additional stores. For non-Mexicans this store is basically a one-stop shop for food, groceries, liquor/spirits, and some toys/clothing/recreational items. Similar to a basic Wal-Mart or Canadian Superstore. I did not pay enough attention to the prices to see how competitive they were to the store on the other side of the parking lot.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

660006895.name: Top rated T-bone and Filet Mignon
660006895.author: a TripAdvisor user
660006895.reviewBody: We have been having the T-bones and Filet Mignon all winter from the Mega and it is delicious. It is a lot better than the meat that we get back in Ontario and at half the price.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

655711344.name: Very nice
655711344.author: a TripAdvisor user
655711344.reviewBody: Looks like a high end Sam\'s club, lots of variety and a very good selection of Tequila,  cheaper then the airport.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

653769490.name: Not as it used to be...
653769490.author: a TripAdvisor user
653769490.reviewBody: We noticed a decline in the way the store was kept in the last few months.  A lot of missing items, empty shelves, dirty aisles, dirty parking log.  Maybe La Comer next door is putting some financial pressure on Mega?  Still getting your basic grocery needs but not as fresh as it used to be a few years ago...

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

653599530.name: Great all-round grocery store!
653599530.author: a TripAdvisor user
653599530.reviewBody: We love shopping at the Mega, which has all the regular supermarket stuff, plus good produce, wine, beer and spirits, and an in house deli which makes things like guacomole, tortillas, flan, salads, etc.  On Tuesdays, local farmers bring in fresh produce which is really nice.\nAnother big supermarket has opened just across from the Mega, called La Comer. It\'s similar to the Mega but a bit more upscale and has some products that the Mega doesn\'t have, and a better selection of wines. Overall we still prefer the Mega as our go to place for groceries and more.  There\'s a small pharmacy in the store as well as some clothing and household items, and bank machines.  In the same mall as the Mega there\'s a MacDonald\'s, a pizza place, a hat store and a few other stores.  \nAnother relatively new supermarket in Bucerias, called Chedraui, also has a good selection of products although it caters somewhat more to locals and less to foreigners.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

653295316.name: Mega has it all
653295316.author: a TripAdvisor user
653295316.reviewBody: At Mega you not only purchase food & beverages but also clothes, toys, drugs, cosmetics & so much more.  Everything is fresh.  It is definitely one stop shopping. It is Dennis & my go to store!\n

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

651918365.name: Recommend Trapiche wine and XX beer.
651918365.author: a TripAdvisor user
651918365.reviewBody: Not a fan of Mexican bakeries but Mega bread is great. Try the walnut bread.  Could not find Dijon mustard\nBut they had soy. Milk so all is good.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

650186320.name: Wonderful Local Grocery Store in Nuevo Vallarta
650186320.author: a TripAdvisor user
650186320.reviewBody: Mega is located on the main highway just south of Bucerias.\nThe store offers a great selection of fresh produce as well as a good meat and seafood department. Prices are very competitive  and for Super Bowl weekend offered  50% off on wines and liquors.\nWe feel Mega is the best of the 3 big grocery stores in the area.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

650147212.name: Shopping trip
650147212.author: a TripAdvisor user
650147212.reviewBody: . A couple English speaking staff helped us out. Good selection of food stuff. Bright and cheery. A short bus ride from our accommodation in Bucerias. Visiting from Jan 3 to March 31. Will go a there few times.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

644647683.name: Great grocery store for timeshare owners
644647683.author: a TripAdvisor user
644647683.reviewBody: Amazing bakery, produce and fresh juices.  Definitely worth the taxi ride to stock up for the week.  And don\'t forget the souvenirs!  Hot chocolate!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

631930613.name: Best super market
631930613.author: a TripAdvisor user
631930613.reviewBody: Clean, lots of choices, and always someone to help you with translation. A great place to shop! Even has a little coffee bar with excellent cappuccino......

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

623857119.name: First Stop - fill up on quick shop
623857119.author: a TripAdvisor user
623857119.reviewBody: Everyone should have a list before getting here. They have the best deli and cheese and salsas home made. water and coke and liquor. cereal. the bread area is wow - and the bread/buns stay fresh for a few days when covered. lol my husband got a jar of salsa and I had already picked up the fresh made green, red and chunky. no jar sauces needed. fruit and hats and very inexpensive vanilla. Watch out for the timeshare men who say "do you need a cab" and get you into a conversation of "would you like free groceries?" We got lots of food for $80 and that included the gifts of hot chocolate (abuella) and vanilla and special whitening soap. leftovers the chamber maid liked.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

620717120.name: Same stock as hotel but cheaper!
620717120.author: a TripAdvisor user
620717120.reviewBody: Stayed at Riu Vallarta about a mile away and came here for cheap cigarettes and souvenirs.  Cigarettes 2.50 British pounds as opposed to 3 in hotel, magnets and keyrings 3 or 4 rather than 8 in hotel.  Large supermarket in a mall with several smaller shops - mainly gift shops and an ice cream parlour, all excellent.  Staff near entrance greet you when you arrive, give you any help you need and order a taxi back to your hotel for you when you are ready to leave.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

617869769.name: Everything you could want
617869769.author: a TripAdvisor user
617869769.reviewBody: Stopped by here to pick up supplies for our stay at a local Riu Hotel , although we were all inclusive I do like to have provisions in the room and any cheap booze we may want to take home . the Store was laid out well and everything was a very good price . It was about a 15 minute walk from the Riu Palace Pacifico and there is a footbridge to get over the main highway. worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

611045146.name: Best Grocery In Bucerias Nayarit Area
611045146.author: a TripAdvisor user
611045146.reviewBody: We have been travelling here for over 30 years and this is our favorite grocery there! They have excellent selections for gourmet items. Their produce, bakery and meat/seafood markets are fantastic as well. Generally speaking their staff is very helpful and try hard to help you find what you need or even refer elsewhere if they don\'t have it! Can\'t go wrong here.....

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

610981609.name: grocery store
610981609.author: a TripAdvisor user
610981609.reviewBody: Love Mega!  They have anything and everything you could possible need.  The newly remodeled store makes it more modern.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

603583974.name: Everything you would ever want
603583974.author: a TripAdvisor user
603583974.reviewBody:
My first time in Mega. Heard alot about it and the place didn't disappoint.Especially liked the 4 ATM machines (HSBC for one) in the store as well as a few banks very close by.
Very much like a Walmart...lots of fresh fruit and seafood and liquor ...Mexican spices ..etc.etc..
Make sure you pickup your Microdyne to wash your veggies and fruit.
Also pickup that Mexican sim card there.
Accept credit cards ...
A 85 pesos cab ride from our hotel in Bucerias ...Corita Y Suites..
Luckily ,I was told before ,to tip the kids that pack/bag your groceries as they do not get paid...5-10 pesos.
It is in a mall so other stores/businesses  that you can explore...Bank of Nova Scotia for one ..

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

590296677.name: Found everything we needed in one spot!
590296677.author: a TripAdvisor user
590296677.reviewBody: Prices are reasonable and they have everything you need. Very similar the supermarkets in United States.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

573474815.name: Everything you need for condo living.
573474815.author: a TripAdvisor user
573474815.reviewBody: As soon as we arrive in Puerto Vallarta, we take a cab fo 60 pesos and do our grocery/alcohol shopping for our condo. It is comparable to a Walmart. Beware of the guys trying to sell time shares as you are exiting the building. Have an ice cream treat at the McDonalds inside.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

571361906.name: You can find everything for a long stay in Riviera Nayarit
571361906.author: a TripAdvisor user
571361906.reviewBody: This store has everything for a family that wants to stay here either for a week or a whole month!\nThey carry everything from local products to international gourmet food. Highly recommended

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

570569105.name: Grocery shopping made fun
570569105.author: a TripAdvisor user
570569105.reviewBody: One of our granddaughters told us that her favorite thing here is shopping at MEGA.  And now, there is La Comer next door.  See if you can get the "straight" story about why two grocery stores are next to each other in the "middle of no where."

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

570232339.name: One stop shopping & great prices!
570232339.author: a TripAdvisor user
570232339.reviewBody:
We stayed in Nuevo Vallarta for one month this past January and used Mega several times during our stay.  Below is a list of "why" we kept coming back even after trying some others stores:

1. Location: if you are staying at the north end of Nuevo Vallarta then this is one of the two closest commercial grocery stores (similar to our Canadian Superstore).  It is approx. a 20-30 minute walk from the Acqua/Aria Condos, or Riu's/Samba hotels. There is also a new grocery store right beside it - also large - and called La Comer.  I believe it specializes in different things, but I heard prices were a little more (however, I cannot personally confirm - we stuck to what we knew because I dislike having to "find" things again in a new grocery store!) 

2.  Selection: you name it they have it ... I even found "ground" chia seeds in the "specialty" section. Along with regular grocery store items they sell things like beach toys, chairs, coolers, suntan lotion, swimsuits, beach towels, clothes, electronics, batteries, pots, pans, brooms, buckets, dishes etc., and have a large Pharmacy with a cosmetic section. (N.B. they are also attached to a mall with a Scotia Bank with an instant teller that we used without issue when taking out $$ - we don't use the ones just outside the grocery store).  The Mall also has a Chiropractor and a number of other clothing shops.   A number of the Mega staff speak English, but not all.  Cashiers have limited English, but we really never had a problem and I would also note that during the snowbird season 90% of the people shopping there speak English and are only too happy to help out (or just use Google translate on your phone).

3.  Spirits;  Ok they have a very LARGE selection of alcoholic products... one whole row is devoted to beer.... most liquor/beer is cheap... we found a few pricey imports (e.g., Gin & Rye - I bought my Bombay Gin at the duty free on the flight there and recall being  glad I did ...otherwise, things like Beer, Rum, Vodka, Kahluha are VERY cheap... wines it depends... they often have a special on Concha y Toro Reservado red/white wines which are surprisingly very good and around 8$ Canadian ... sometimes they offer two for one or buy one get one for 50% off ... during the time we were there was always some sort of sale.  To give you an idea of cost a 40 oz. of Rum/Vodka sold for around $12-13 Canadian  (yes you heard me right)... Beer was on average a 1.50 (e.g. Tecate)... Corona was I believe around the same & give or take a few cents depending on the brand.  Kahlua was 12$ Cdn for a 40 oz bottle (I know unbelievable!).  I also bought my Kahlua at Mega before going going back to Canada and they had a special - buy one Liquor at the reg. price and get one ar 50% so for 2 - 40 oz bottles of Kahlua it cost me under 20$ Canadian!! (No misprint!). The airport duty-free was A LOT more N.B. just remember if you buy it in the grocery store it has to go in your suitcase (NOT carry on) when you take it home - watch your weight - any luggage over 50 lbs starts costing you big time at the airport)  I believe a bottle of Kahlua weighs approx. 8 lbs. - so best to bring a small digital scale to check your luggage before you head home.

4.  Prices:  loose vegetables and fruit are super cheap in Mexico.   I had to look twice because I could not believe how cheap; most are priced by the KILO!  I think I paid around $4.00 this winter at Superstore for one very large orange pepper... In Mexico an orange pepper was .59 cents a KILO... Meats are little more if you like North american style cuts.  Chicken is cheap, fish is cheap.  They have a red meat called Arracherra ... which is very good ... pre-seasoned ... kind of like a small roast - very nice!!

5.  Taxis:  Obviously you won't be walking home with a load of groceries.  Taxis are always at the main entrance and all drivers speak decent English ... at the time of writing (early 2018) a taxi back to the Riu's, Acqua/Aria, or Samba area was 85 pesos or approx $6.00 Cdn.

Hope this helps a bit!!!  Happy Snowbirding!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

567337352.name: Everything you want
567337352.author: a TripAdvisor user
567337352.reviewBody: Mega is the location Linda and I visit when we vacation in Mexico. We are there for at least one month so we need a few items to stock our shelves. This store not only has just about everything you need, the employees are friendly and most speak much better english than I speak Spanish. The store is very clean and well stocked.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

566565518.name: Tried to find a sweatshirt
566565518.author: a TripAdvisor user
566565518.reviewBody: Took a cab to the Mega. I tried to find a women\'s sweatshirt, but they had none. Then my husband suggested I try the men\'s department, and I found a small there that fit. The cabbie told me I probably could have found a better selection at the department store facing La Mega, but I\'d already bought the shirt.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

566111676.name: Mega is getting better
566111676.author: a TripAdvisor user
566111676.reviewBody: Visited the Mega and was impressed--it seems to be cleaner and more organized than in the past. Very nice grocery/department store with lots of stuff for all your needs.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

564143619.name: A good alternative to big box Sams and Walmart in PV
564143619.author: a TripAdvisor user
564143619.reviewBody: After visiting the La Comer right next door, we stopped in for a quick visit.  Store is clean, large, variety galore and very helpful staff.  Bought a few more items we forgot at La Comer... dog food, wheat bread, souvenirs, peanut butter, beer, coke lite, and a couple other misc. things...  Good store.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

562395895.name: Mega and la Comer
562395895.author: a TripAdvisor user
562395895.reviewBody: La Comer is amazing. I would compare it to a Raleys. I\u2019m from Caligornia. We spent so much time walking up and down the aisles. Lots of choices. I love Mega so we went there too. Lots of people at Mega not so many at Comer. They are brand new. Taxi driver said less expensive. Not sure I agree. Still very nice clean store. Will go back.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

559862980.name: Great Store and So is La Comer!
559862980.author: a TripAdvisor user
559862980.reviewBody: I love the Mega Grocery Store.  And now I also love La Comer!!  La Comer is amazing. I hear it\u2019s the same owner. So enjoy both!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

558185059.name: A "Must"
558185059.author: a TripAdvisor user
558185059.reviewBody: This is always our first stop. They have just about everything you will need from beer to laundry soap to clothes. It\'s like a mini Walmart and I like that the locals use it too. They have taxi guys waiting outside for you. *Remember to tip the people that bag your groceries* they do not get paid from the store and just work for tips. They are usually young kids or older people. Great place and great prices!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

557005721.name: First stop to pick up your beach necessities.
557005721.author: a TripAdvisor user
557005721.reviewBody: We packed our beach toys, & floaty\'s with us. Next trip we will go to the Mega right away and pick up the toys and a beach umbrella. This will save some weight in our bags.\nYou can also pick up food, drinks, clothing or pharmacy items. From our hotel it was very inexpensive for a cab.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

552989394.name: Great Place To Shop
552989394.author: a TripAdvisor user
552989394.reviewBody:
This is our 4th year shopping at Mega. It has most items that you buy at home.  Ok the  prices are a little higher on most items, but that happens when you want the good you are used too.
You can buy any thing at Mega from a stove to a donut. Their produce section is wonderful and the prices very reasonable.

Yes Mega has a new store right next door called Le Comer, it even has more items than Mega, minus a TV, Electronics dept.
Over all both stores are a go to place to shop.

Dr.Rico
Canada

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

552045770.name: Great but not as awesome as La Comer
552045770.author: a TripAdvisor user
552045770.reviewBody: We\'ve been in this grocery store twice when we first arrived Nayarit.  They have everything we needed but it\'s too crowded and one time we were even approached by a time share seller.  Go figure.  We liked it but La Comer is better which is in the same area of Mega.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

551584318.name: Mega: a One-Stop shopping dream...
551584318.author: a TripAdvisor user
551584318.reviewBody:
We always hit up a "Mega" whenever we goto Mexico. Its a great place to pick up things you may have forgotten for your trip--sunscreen, clothing, sandals, swim wear, snacks, etc. A great selection of booze--cheaper than in Canada, that's for sure.  Its a clean, fun store to shop in, and it is well laid out. 

..We generally like to peruse the aisles of this mega mexican shopping store everytime we are in Mexico. W visited the Bucerias Mega (just down the highway from Bucerias) in December 2017. 

.. Its worth a trip as its a definite 'non touristy' thing to do! Thank you to Senora Martha for bagging our groceries and helping us find an item. Gracias!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

538734061.name: Better than Walmart
538734061.author: a TripAdvisor user
538734061.reviewBody: There is everything you could need while on vacation.  A great shopping experience.  Everyone in our party prefers Mega to Walmart.  Not nearly as crowded and the people appear more friendly.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

528981711.name: Interesting Experience
528981711.author: a TripAdvisor user
528981711.reviewBody: This is certainly not a highlight of anyone\'s vacation, but we really enjoy experiences that reveal more of the local culture without a purely tourist agenda.  While the Mega certainly still aims to service the local tourism, it also provides an experience that reveals more of the local culture.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

526108146.name: The One Stop Shop
526108146.author: a TripAdvisor user
526108146.reviewBody: Everything you need is here. Fresh fruit, store-made bakery items (like churros yum!), beer, sunblock, and even beachwear is found here. We were even able to pick up an emergency asthma pump at the pharmacy (salbutamol/Ventolin) for $55 pesos when my SO was running low! Great store!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

520103277.name: A must visit
520103277.author: a TripAdvisor user
520103277.reviewBody: If you are staying in the area, this is the place to stop and get your supplies.  In addition to being a complete modern supermarket, it has domestic goods and hardware.  There\'s an aisle in the middle with "international" groceries.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

519934228.name: I love it here!! Everything in one place!
519934228.author: a TripAdvisor user
519934228.reviewBody: Food, beach air mattresses and inflatables, household items, name it, they have it!!! Rather walk up and buy here than the horrid resort tourist prices!! Great place to stock up on items you\'ve forgotten to pack!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

494056016.name: Love the  Mega
494056016.author: a TripAdvisor user
494056016.reviewBody: We always come to the Mega on our trips to the Bucerias area. It never stops to amaze us at the price, quality and service you get at Mega.  Great place to get your supplies if you are vacationing here.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

490495646.name: This is the place to shop!
490495646.author: a TripAdvisor user
490495646.reviewBody: We have shopped at the Mega in PV, Playa del Carmen and Cozumel.  In PV, the groceries are plentiful and reasonably priced.  If you forgot something at home (toothpaste, aspirin, lotion etc.) you can find it here too.  Do not buy Mexican vanilla at a souvenir store, buy it here instead, since it is better priced and very good.  When you check out, remember to leave a few pesos for the grocery bagger.  That\'s how they earn their living. -Some are elderly and would really benefit from it . And you won\'t miss those few pesos at all.  Downstairs in the PV Mega, there are shops that have great deals on nice souvenir t-shirts - better than any of the shops on the Malacon.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

489200800.name: One Stop Shopping
489200800.author: a TripAdvisor user
489200800.reviewBody: While vacationing in Bucerias, we have made many trips over the years to the Mega.  We now stay in Rincon de Guayabitos, and we make sure to stop into the Mega to buy the essentials that are hard to get in Guayabitos. The Mega is a lot like the big box stores back home (Walmart/Superstore) for shopping for groceries. They also have a good selection of beer and wine. There is also a Bank of Nova Scotia on site to pick up some pesos if required.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

488222046.name: Great place for just about everything
488222046.author: a TripAdvisor user
488222046.reviewBody: This big box store can satisfy most of your needs, allowing you more vacation time and less travel back into PV. Fresh bakery, large meat section, wide variety of wine and spirits, fresh fruits and vegetables, staples and a fair amount of natural, organic and international offerings. Plus the soft goods in case you need clothes, kitchen items, electronic and pharmacy items. Located within a strip center, Subway, GNC and gym, bank and other store fronts. Don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

487146768.name: All of the Essentials and Then Some!
487146768.author: a TripAdvisor user
487146768.reviewBody:
The MEGA stores are like department and grocery stores combined.  I have found their food prices to be generally very good with a great selection and high quality.  Often they will have specials so I always look for the tags.  I suggest checking MEGA before buying such things as a T-Shirt, sun dress, or a bottle of vanilla before paying tourist prices at the small shops.  There are some small shops downstairs just as you come in the front door which already have prices equal to or lower than you might get by bartering elsewhere.  Their prices are set and not open to negotiations.  

So far all of the MEGA stores I have been to in Mexico have an ATM machine (to withdraw pesos) that is not a rip-off however the one at this particular store was not working when I was there.  

Don't forget to tip the person bagging your purchases a few pesos.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

472730999.name: great shoppinh!!!
472730999.author: a TripAdvisor user
472730999.reviewBody: We shop here in a regular basis!!! Excellent deli, bakery,  and meat....Don\'t always have pork tenderloin....Pharmacy staff are very helpful....Their international section has also improved since we arrived here.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

470891905.name: Good place to shop
470891905.author: a TripAdvisor user
470891905.reviewBody: We stopped here while on vacation at the Sheraton Resort in Puerto Vallarta.  They had a wide-range of things for purchase.  We were able to purchase breakfast items and drinks for the beach.  We bought some items from the bakery.  It seemed like this was a good place for the locals to shop.  The prices were good.  The service at checkout was excellent.  We were able to pay with our credit card.  Nice clean place.  I highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

470409228.name: One Stop Shop for everything
470409228.author: a TripAdvisor user
470409228.reviewBody: Really the place to go for all your food and other needs.  Kinda like a Walmart with other things than just foood

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

468957463.name: Has everthing from soup to nuts including timeshare salesman.
468957463.author: a TripAdvisor user
468957463.reviewBody: If you are American or Canafian.....Avoid the front door and use the side door moving as quickly to the vegetables if you can to avoid the timeshare salesmen.  But they will run you down.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

465304630.name: Our go supermarket!!
465304630.author: a TripAdvisor user
465304630.reviewBody: We have been shopping here for most of our supplies for the last 6 years.....It just gets better!!!! If only they stocked Tillamook cheese!!!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

457986598.name: Mexican Walmart
457986598.author: a TripAdvisor user
457986598.reviewBody: I read reviews of this store and had to have a look for myself on the way back from Bucerias.  \n\nPretty much the same as Walmart but Mexican, a cool shopping experience.  We picked up a peice of luggage, tequila, some clothing etc...  Great prices and great service from the staff despite my limited command of Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

454999641.name: We always stop here before settling in from the airport ride
454999641.author: a TripAdvisor user
454999641.reviewBody:
Getting your condo set up and ready for your vacation / stay is important once you land and want to get to your destination. Before you do, stop at Mega and get the things you need in one organized shopping experience. 

Wine, liquor, beer, all check. Fresh vegetables and meats, deli and bakery, again check. Forgot clothing, supplies, all here and check. 

The prices are more than reasonable. The only suggestion is make a list prior to coming and avoid buying way more than needed. A tip I suggest is bring your shopping bags from the states in an easily accessible spot to shop with. 

For Americans, if you are at the deli, remember a kilo is a hugh amount, pair it down for your travel needs.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

454014162.name: Everything you Need
454014162.author: a TripAdvisor user
454014162.reviewBody: With the opening of the Commercial Mega store visitors and residents in Bucerias are now able to show in the air-conditioned comfort of a store that supplies just about anything. This was our 3rd time visiting Bucerias and the convenience of having a huge supermarket like MEGA made our shopping experience fantastic. No more having to travel all the way in to Puerto Vallarta to get supplies. The prices were comparative, there was ample parking, the shop was spotlessly clean and we were able to find everything we wanted.

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

442672005.name: Everything you need in one stop!
442672005.author: a TripAdvisor user
442672005.reviewBody: This is your one stop shop! Food clothes, electronics you name it they have it! The prices are great and they have all you need so why go anywhere else!!! Also great place for alcohol

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

441612186.name: Gotta hit the Mega Store.. wine, tequila, snacks,
441612186.author: a TripAdvisor user
441612186.reviewBody: This store is fun, as it is uniquely mexican.  Anything you could possibly need is here & yea, worth the cab ride. Everything is priced better than Walmart & when they have a liquor sale (2 for 1) it\'s a score - Chilean wines, good tequila brands, bean dip, chips, good cheese selection, stuff to have on hand so u don\'t always have to go out to eat if it\'s been a long day in the sun..

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

441348260.name: Good Shopping and Rather Fun
441348260.author: a TripAdvisor user
441348260.reviewBody: If you\'re staying in a timeshare or condo this is the place to go to get supplies. A good choice of merchandise and the staff is quite helpful

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

437217974.name: Great Bargain Don Juluo 70 Tequila
437217974.author: a TripAdvisor user
437217974.reviewBody: When you go to Puerto Vallarta make sure you go to a Mega Commercial Store. We were able to find Don Julio 70 Tequila for $30.00 a bottle, in the states it\'s $60.00!!!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

428217279.name: Great vege, meat, seafood, ceviche, deli, bulk olives etc.  Prices great
428217279.author: a TripAdvisor user
428217279.reviewBody: Condo eat on a budget-your savings on soda and beer alone will compensate for more than cab fare.  Note:  baggers are not generally store emplyees in MX-they survive on your tips and right now 10 pesos are about 50 cents

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

425996462.name: nice supermaket
425996462.author: a TripAdvisor user
425996462.reviewBody: only a 5 min taxi ride from riu palace,my family and I went there for a few odds and ends,,cranberry juice,ball for little girl)...this was a well stocked supermarket ,very good cake and bread section,and baby needs section

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

406304732.name: Has Everything!!
406304732.author: a TripAdvisor user
406304732.reviewBody: Great place to shop!!! Little known secret.....Wednesday\'s produce is 1/2 price!!!!! Lots of taxis available! Very helpful staff!!

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

393071262.name: Great place to stock up
393071262.author: a TripAdvisor user
393071262.reviewBody: Mega was great for provisions on the way to Punta de mita. Huge selection and good prices. Convenient to highway. Mega has everything from groceries to clothing. \n

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

383280830.name: Kind of like Walmart
383280830.author: a TripAdvisor user
383280830.reviewBody:
Been here many times... It is a great place to pick up almost anything when staying in Nuevo Vallarta...

I usually stop here before I go to the resort I am staying at...

They have pretty much everything that Walmart or Target has.... Fresh fruits and veggies... frozen food.. fresh meats and fish.... alcohol... soda... beer... water.....

They even have clothes, sun tan lotion, laundry detergent...

Prices are great. 

I have never had an issue with service here... I will go back...

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

376266733.name: Excellent grocery and more shopping store
376266733.author: a TripAdvisor user
376266733.reviewBody: Similar to Walmart but a with a little more Mexican flavour.  You can find everything (except for sour cream :-)).  Great bakery/pastry corner, great beer and wine selection, fresh meat and fish, dairy and all your typical grocery store aisles.  A very good cosmetic and beauty products section and also household goods, including appliances.  Let\'s not forget clothing and shoes!\nDon\'t be intimidated by the ladies trying to attract you to the deli counter (they must be on a commission agreement) or by the young women trying to sell you sun screen products.\nPrices are reasonable and it is a fun bus ride if you stay in the surrounding area.  We visit the store at least a couple of times a week and we actually enjoy trying all the Mexican items that we cannot find in Canada...

address.streetAddress: Club Residencial, Flamingos Carretera Tepic - Puerto Vallarta, 1297, Flamingos Nuevo Vallarta, Bucerias, Nayarit, Mexico

670481307.name: Great fun for the kiddos (and a break for parents!)
670481307.author: a TripAdvisor user
670481307.reviewBody:
We had walked for an hour along the beach to Bucerias, had lunch, and was about to hit some flea markets when my kids (12 and 14) suggested to me that they may enjoy this water park more than shopping, lol.

We obliged, and paid 350 pesos each for an hour - a bit pricy but not totally unreasonable compared to the price of these activities in Canada.

In our Canadian aqua obstacle parks, kids are driven over to the structure by boat. In true laid-back Mexican style, they were given life jackets and told to start swimming! No problem with that for our kids - but not sure how it would work for younger kids. I'm sure they would get help from the lifeguards.

The kids had a blast for over an hour - the office is in touch with the lifeguards by radio, so was able to radio in when we needed to leave.

There is a viewing area with tables and chairs (and a little restaurant serving cheap beer and eats), so Mom and Dad had a lovely time too ;)

669954592.name: Such a fun time for all ages!
669954592.author: a TripAdvisor user
669954592.reviewBody: We recently spent the afternoon here and it was so much fun! I\u2019m scared of water but still had such a good time. You receive life jackets and there\u2019s so many great lifeguards to help navigate and pull you up! 100% recommend trying out! I took my 5yo, 9yo and 14yo and we all had fun!

666034734.name: Surprised
666034734.author: a TripAdvisor user
666034734.reviewBody: Wibex Mex is giant inflatable anchored off the beach in Bucer\u00edas. We were surprised to find the prices expensive! Not sure if it is seasonal but $450 pesos per person for an hour seems a bit much in comparison to other Wibits that I have been to, specifically - Kelowna. We were surprised by the amount of weather that also affected out play. . . we happened to go on an overcast/windy day which made the Wibit bounce quite a bit in the chop. While I can put up with that the children in our group did not enjoy it as much. Smaller children (less than age 7) had more difficulty navigating the waves (between 6-8 feet) to even swim out to the float and had to be brought out by lifeguards. The parts are abundant and somewhat securely fastened - again windy enough on our day to be velcroing apart. The bottom of the wibit apparatus did seem slimy and may have had barnacles from being in the salt water continuously. The gentleman that seems to be the owner/operator that took our payment was helpful in sizing us up for the mandatory life jackets. He seems to reiterate that there were four lifeguards out there to help today making is seems more unusual than standard. Overall, we did spend almost our whole hour out there although there was not an easy way to tell the time. Overall, we had an average time . . . had we a better understanding of how much the weather affected our play we might\u2019ve picked a calmer day.

665269982.name: Aqua Obstacle Course
665269982.author: a TripAdvisor user
665269982.reviewBody: Sure fun way to exhaust your children and self.  Go early in the morning when the waves are calm, it got very rough in the afternoon. The lifeguards are great, they provide life jackets for everyone, and the equipment is new and well-maintained. Note: wear long-sleeves and pants if possible as the Velcro and plastic can be scratchy. Wear A LOT of sunscreen as you cant keep hats or sunglasses on to do the course.  They offer one-hour or all-day package options.

658244405.name: You Have To Try It!
658244405.author: a TripAdvisor user
658244405.reviewBody: My 13 year old granddaughter loved it so much she did it twice! Norah says she felt like a competitor in the show Wipe Out! The staff were happy and energetic and super encouraging. She loved the obstacles and variety of things to do....some activities very challenging others easier and appropriate for younger kids (or her 36 year old mother!).

655654872.name: Highlight of My Trip!!!!
655654872.author: a TripAdvisor user
655654872.reviewBody: This floating obstacle course was an absolute blast!!  My husband and I took our niece and nephew, ages 10 and 8, and had the tie of our lives.  It costed us 1400 pesos total or $20USD/person for 1 hour and it was 100% worth it.  We were fortunate enought o have the entire structure to ourselves but that\'s not typical.  A certified lifeguard is with you at all times, never taking his eyes off you.  Super well run and a must do, with out without children, a great way to get in a work out.  Be sure to have pesos with you, thier debit/credit machine is not up and running as of yet.

655299633.name: It\u2019s fun
655299633.author: a TripAdvisor user
655299633.reviewBody: We had done this before at another location. Its fun and safe as there are lifeguards with you. Its a great workout without even really knowing it! We paid for the day pass but only went for an hour as it was a touch cold. Kids enjoyed watching me fumble around - they are much more nimble than me! Need to be careful in spots as there is some bare velcro that can give you some scatches.

650965647.name: Good value good time
650965647.author: a TripAdvisor user
650965647.reviewBody: Kids got the day pass for $500 pecos they played hard for an hour. The life guards interacted with them helped them out of the water and even played with them. We went for lunch and they played again for another hour. My kids are very athletic so it was right up their alley. if there was something\u2019s they couldn\u2019t do but the life guards help them . Best part was you got a boogie board too so then they played with those in the waves after. I sat at a restaurant on a lawn chair enjoying food and bevies

585432573.name: What an experience
585432573.author: a TripAdvisor user
585432573.reviewBody: We had so much fun and it came with a workout! The counter staff are very friendly and one, Jessie, is fluent in both English and Spanish. They supply you with lifejackets for the adventure and have lifeguards available to swim with you out to the wibit if needed. We ran around, fell in and cause I laugh at all my clumsiness, required the lifeguards to help me out as I was laughing too hard to pull myself up. The wibit is much larger once you are on it than it looks from the beach. You have the choice of purchasing a 1 hour pass or a full day pass....depending on how energetic you feel! It is a must try for everyone of all ages as you\'d be amazed at how much fun it is to exercise again! can\'t wait to go back!

571377019.name: Cool activity, give it a try
571377019.author: a TripAdvisor user
571377019.reviewBody:
Found the cost reasonable for a specialty activity like this at $20 for an hour or $40 for the day. Obviously better value in the day pass which for older kids I would definitely recommend, crazy how quick 60 minutes goes by.

Our children are only 8 and had a bit of trouble with some of the obstacles. Makes sense however as the park is built for 5yrs through adults so needs to appeal to all. The staff recognized this and were awesome in assisting them on the tougher stuff.

I did not go with them as wanted to have lunch with my wife.. however I wish now I had, as would have been really fun, my loss! We will do again on our next visit.

One thing to note is we lathered the kids in sunblock before they went and think this impeded there ability to grip the structures. Would probably put them in UV quick dry pants the next time.

Give it a try

570528941.name: great fun
570528941.author: a TripAdvisor user
570528941.reviewBody: Our two boys, age 10 and 13 went out for an hour.  350 pesos each.  4 lifegueards were out there, with only about 8 kids max while our kids were on it.  mandatory lifejackets- was fairly safe in my opinion.  kids had to swim out to it.  \nour youngest got motion sick by the end.  recommend you give a child a ginger gravol if they are prone to sickness.  Never thought about this prior. bit it is moving in the waves all the time. lots of places for parents to sit and watch from the shore...

570145290.name: So Much Fun
570145290.author: a TripAdvisor user
570145290.reviewBody: What a great attraction for kids (and adults!)  Highly recommend for families.  Great staff and well priced.

568735661.name: Teens loved it!
568735661.author: a TripAdvisor user
568735661.reviewBody: Our teen daughters had a blast! They said that the people working there were fun and helpful. $20/hour per person. We (parents) walked down the beach for a massage while the girls had fun. Win-win for everyone!

565660303.name: Amazing experience
565660303.author: a TripAdvisor user
565660303.reviewBody: Had a great time doing this, fun for all ages. Definitely a work out! Jesse who works there is extremely helpful and ensured we had a great time!

564875314.name: Kids had a blast
564875314.author: a TripAdvisor user
564875314.reviewBody: My boys are 7 and 9 and I think they were the perfect ages for this activity.  They were able to swim out themselves and once they were out there their are lifeguards on duty that play with and watch them.  We only did the hour but I think my kids would have played longer if we would have let them.  My husband and I sat in the chairs on the beach had a little snack and drank some coronas while they played.  It was a great time for all of us!

563763979.name: Probably more of a diversion for young people
563763979.author: a TripAdvisor user
563763979.reviewBody: My wife chose to swim out to "Wonderland." I chose to remain on shore taking countless pictures of her sloshing about on the floating venue.  She spent about 1/2 hour exhausting herself.  She slept very well that evening.  The next day she complained bitterly that she was sore.  No doubt it is a workout, and probably one best reserved for the young.  I can see great value in exhausting the kids here.  What a great place to send them while mom and dad and, especially true if it\'s grandma and grandpa, enjoy a nice drink at one of the many nearby beach front restaurants.

551807593.name: Wibit Survivor fun!!
551807593.author: a TripAdvisor user
551807593.reviewBody: Kids spent the afternoon out on the water on this adventure.  Watching them from the beach they clearly had a blast.  A good way to cool off and burn off some energy for sure.

550649245.name: Great entertainment for our teenagers!
550649245.author: a TripAdvisor user
550649245.reviewBody: The kids loved this park. Great way to spend an hour or more. It is a workout for sure! Easy to find just up the beach from the market. We went earlier in the day as it got pretty busy by early afternoon.

550194681.name: Fun but hard workout!
550194681.author: a TripAdvisor user
550194681.reviewBody: Man was that ever a workout!!  Hy husband and I went yesterday at about 330pm and it wasn\'t too busy. My husband was able to conquer every obstacle (he is in very good shape). On the other hand, I am not very agile or strong so it was very difficult but still a blast! If you fall in the water, there are a couple places that are a little easier to get up (my husband still had to help me) but if you still can\'t get back on, one of the lifeguards will come and pull you up.  There are no rope ladders to climb up (which would have really helped!) An hour was plenty of time to enjoy the whole course- not sure we could have handled more, haha. Life jackets are mandatory. With our current exchange rate, it cost about 22$ Canadian each for the hour. When you\'re done, there are 2 little shower huts you can use to change (10 pesos if you want to shower). My parents enjoyed watching (and laughing at) us from the second floor of Bleakers bar. Hope it\'s still there next year so we can do it when we come back!

549355852.name: Kids had fun. A few sharp edges and Velcro burns
549355852.author: a TripAdvisor user
549355852.reviewBody: This is a fun activity.   My 12 and 15 year olds spent almost two hours while we parents sat at one of the restaurants on the beach enjoying the food, beer, sun/shade and beautiful setting.  It\u2019s a bit pricey by Mexican and even US standards but if the cost is acceptable it\u2019s a fun way to spend a part of the day.   Everyone wears a life vest.  Staff on the water lightly supervises.   Staff at the beach \u201cstorefront\u201d handles the transaction.   Hang out at Mar y Sol or Adauto\u2019s while the kids are playing, or join them too.  There were several families though it never seemed crowded.

515021444.name: Super fun and inexpensive activity in Bucerias!
515021444.author: a TripAdvisor user
515021444.reviewBody:
This was so much fun! My daughter (7) loved it, and there were lifeguards to help her. My wife and I had a ball too. The activity is somewhat physicial - we were totally tired out after an hour of playing on this water obstacle course.
It was very safe - we had life jackets, and there were several lifeguards to help us. 
Water was very warm in August, we were not cold at all!
Price was very reasonable, and it was so much fun!
Just remember to bring a change of clothes and towels for after.

511555073.name: Fun and exciting
511555073.author: a TripAdvisor user
511555073.reviewBody: This is a nice, inexpensive little area in Bucerias, on the beach to go and enjoy some fun in the water. $20USD a person.

659561129.name: Beautiful Pool and friendly staff
659561129.author: a TripAdvisor user
659561129.reviewBody: The pool at Los Arroyos Verdes is beautiful and not overly busy. The staff are friendly and the food is delicious. We enjoyed our time at the pool and were pleasantly surprised to find out that they frequently have musicians or other entertainment events for their guests. This is a great way to relax on a hot and sunny day in Mexico.

657811749.name: A lovely afternoon
657811749.author: a TripAdvisor user
657811749.reviewBody: What a great surprise this is!! Performance spaces, shady walks, a really great poolside and bar area with A-1 live entertainment. The food was a bit of a disappointment. Sometimes you just order the wrong thing from the menu, when something else would have been really good!?  The pizza is forgettable, but our table-mates enjoyed the shrimp dishes and more traditional food.

646599982.name: Went for the concert
646599982.author: a TripAdvisor user
646599982.reviewBody: This was a total rip off. Really bad service, expensive drinks, overpriced entertainment. I absolutely will not be back.

593282443.name: Dirty pool
593282443.author: a TripAdvisor user
593282443.reviewBody: I was pregnant swimming here and got a bacterial infection. They rarely clean the pool. Especially in low season when money is tight. BEWARE.

581133989.name: Art day at El Arroyo
581133989.author: a TripAdvisor user
581133989.reviewBody: My friend and former resident and I visited for a relaxing afternoon to rock paint and enjoy the ambiance. Sadly the bar and restaurant were closed for the season, but we had a lovely time by the pool.

556127130.name: Thanksgiving dinner
556127130.author: a TripAdvisor user
556127130.reviewBody: We went there with a group of 12 people for Thanksgiving dinner and we were thoughtfully impressed with its beautiful garden like location, great food and musical performance that we witnessed!  Job well done.

474468987.name: An alternative to the beach
474468987.author: a TripAdvisor user
474468987.reviewBody: Tired of getting sand in your beer? Try an afternoon poolside at Los Arroyos Verdes. Good food, lots of comfortable seating, loungers and even hammocks, and a fabulous pool combine to make your visit a memorable one. And there is live music on the pool deck every Sunday afternoon. The day pass cost (300 pesos) is waived if you spend at least that much for food or drinks. And don\'t forget to take stroll around the grounds to enjoy the gardens and the wonderfully eclectic decorations.

460523514.name: Another new adventure
460523514.author: a TripAdvisor user
460523514.reviewBody: Enjoyed my day here.  Wonderful pool for swimming, and the food was plentiful and fresh.  Changing facilities were clean and pleasant and there was a great deal lounging furniture to choose from.  If you get the day pass, it includes the food you eat and transportation to and from Bucerais.

448123644.name: A Place for Peace and Tranquility
448123644.author: a TripAdvisor user
448123644.reviewBody: We have visited Los Arroyos several times over the last 4 years and have used their spa facilities each time.  Although very rustic and small, the masseuse is excellent, considerate and caring.  Using the spa services gave us the opportunity to use the beautiful facilities for the day.  We really enjoyed sitting in comfortable couches on the "island in the pool."  The grounds are immaculate and the facilities are very unique in their rustic decor.  Los Arroyos is not the typical place that a tourist would go because it is a drive out into the countryside of Bucerias, but it is well worth a visit especially if you have a car.

447872065.name: Oasis of relaxation, in Bucerias
447872065.author: a TripAdvisor user
447872065.reviewBody: We have enjoyed many days at the Los Arroyos Verdes.   It is not the ocean, it is not a flea market setting, but it is a beautiful oasis of green around a pool and restaurant that has the best ceviche in all of Puerto Vallarta.   It is definitely worth a day or two of your holiday time after some busy market and ocean days.

444305957.name: Wonderful Lomi Lomi massages!
444305957.author: a TripAdvisor user
444305957.reviewBody: This is a wonderful oasis! Eduardo came and picked us up and brought us to the enchanting garden settting of Arroyos Verdes. Justina did my Hawaiian Lomi Lomi massage. She is delightful and the massage was wonderful. So much so that my mom and I came back on our way back to the airport and had massages again. Their spa menu costs half as much as in the states, so go indulge yourself. My mom also raved about her pedicure. The restaurant is a lovely setting to relax by the pool before returning to the hustle of the beach. I highly recommend a meal and a spa service if you are in the area.

444023038.name: A wonderful oasis - be prepared to chill!
444023038.author: a TripAdvisor user
444023038.reviewBody: A friend and I spent the day here taking advantage of the $300p per person a day visitor charge.  This amount is a credit at the restaurant/bar so you get to eat and drink for the day using up your credit - go, it\'s a bargain. Lovely manicured grounds, friendly and efficient staff, (Guadalupe the owner is a treasure), great pool and the food at the restaurant was excellent. We were picked up in La Cruz in the morning and delivered back again around suppertime after a super relaxing day. If you want  peace and quiet go during the week as there is live music on the weekends.

387818851.name: Paradise in Bucerias
387818851.author: a TripAdvisor user
387818851.reviewBody: Arroyos Verde is a beautiful retreat for the day.  You can buy a day pass, hang out at the pool...have lunch in their beautiful poolside restaurant along with a cocktail.  The main features are all of the many types of artifacts, pieces of art and very cool antiques from around the country that the owner has acquired over the years.  Arroyos is a very fun place to spend a day or an afternoon.  We highly recommend it.

365374865.name: Great massages and atompshere
365374865.author: a TripAdvisor user
365374865.reviewBody: We actually spent most of the afternoon here after some awesome massages.  I think we spent less than $50 USD each for 90 mins.  The people were great and one of the managers Eddy came down to our condo in Terralta to pick us up and drop us back off.  Great experience and one of the best massages I have had here in Bucerias.

334102859.name: Very relaxingg
334102859.author: a TripAdvisor user
334102859.reviewBody: After a week of exploring Bucerias, we spent the day on Sunday here. There was live music, good food, and a truly relaxing atmosphere. I took a nap on a little outside bed and laid in a hammock, swam in the pool, wrote in my journal and read my kindle. It was great! I would recommend a day here.

330218472.name: Well worth investigating!
330218472.author: a TripAdvisor user
330218472.reviewBody: A group of five on a Sunday afternoon as the property is open to the public - sort of an open house.  You can tour the property, eat at the restaurant, and swim in the pool, which is normally available only to those staying on the property.  You might ask why a tour of a property that has rental units available by the night, the week, the month, or season.  It\'s because this property is so unique.  There are approximately 40 rental units.  Two of which are remodeled Airstream Trailers, others are various configurations of 1 or 2 bedroom living units, that have kitchens, dining area, living rooms, bedrooms, bathrooms, and outdoor living spaces.  In addition, the property has lots of unique nooks and crannies for BBQ\'s, sporting activities, spa facility, or areas to meditate.  The pool is large with a "U" shape design.  On Sunday a band sets up a stage in the "island" formed by the "U".  Also on Sunday, the chef prepares a special meal.  Our meal for two consisted of three chile rellenos, one filled with cheese, one beef, and one shrimp - delicious.  In addition, you get two glasses of wine.  Priced at $230 pesos.  If you are staying for a period of time there are organized activities to take part in. A shuttle will take you to Bucerias or nearby LaCruz for shopping / farmers market events.\nPerhaps more important is the feeling of warmth that you receive from the owner and the staff.  They really care about making sure their guests enjoy the time spent at Los Arroyos Verdes. And we felt this as only Sunday patrons.  Those that stay for an extended period must really feel the love. Definitely worth investigating!

327600909.name: great food.
327600909.author: a TripAdvisor user
327600909.reviewBody: A friend of mine brought me here the first time a few years ago when i was visiting his home in Bucerias. There is a restaurant here called Karens Place. The food, service and the view are worth checking out. Great spot for lunch! If your in the area check it out.

278102306.name: Great Food and Facilities
278102306.author: a TripAdvisor user
278102306.reviewBody: The staff, and management were all the best that anyone could ask for. We stayed two months at Los Arroyos Verdes this last winter and I have only good things to say about this resort.

266017464.name: What A  Hidden Gem
266017464.author: a TripAdvisor user
266017464.reviewBody:
This is a oasis in Bucerias. Open to the public on Sundays if you are not staying at this lovely off the ocean resort.
It has a huge pool with a covered bandstand type of building in the centre. Wow.
The food is wonderful and fresh from their menu and kitchen. The waite staff will keep you happy with exotic drinks from the bar.
You must spend 300 pesos each minimum during the day to take advantage of the resort. Well worth the price for a day around the pool and to hear the live entertainment. This whole experience is a 10++ event. They have done every thing right to make you feel welcome.
We found out about this place in oir last month in Bucerias. We went back two Sundays in a row.
It will be a go back place for us next winter for sure.

249005499.name: Mas Verdes!
249005499.author: a TripAdvisor user
249005499.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to stay for 2 weeks, and I still don\'t think I was able to take in all of the personal touches and loving details.  Every inch of the property is like a magic garden.  It\'s not only eco friendly, but people friendly as well.  Pollo, the architects son, was a massive bonus to this resort and goes above and beyond to make sure every guest has an excellent experience.

246504266.name: SPA
246504266.author: a TripAdvisor user
246504266.reviewBody: wonderful setting, very relaxed atmosphere complete with pool and wonderful plants. The owner Lupe is a wonderful person who is very involved with different charities. The mushroom burger served here is the best I have ever tasted,

232135936.name: My Home Away from Home
232135936.author: a TripAdvisor user
232135936.reviewBody: Loved the feeling at Los Arroyos Verdes.  My little 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite was an excellent way to escape the Canadian winter for a few months.  Loved it so much, I am going back again to enjoy it some more

206948079.name: Los Arroyos Verdes is just incredible
206948079.author: a TripAdvisor user
206948079.reviewBody: You gotta check the creativity and originality in this place. A safe peaceful heaven that feels like Mexico. Lovely

198122437.name: Extremely Relaxing
198122437.author: a TripAdvisor user
198122437.reviewBody: I went here just for a day trip and had a phenomenal experience.  The food was very good and the options of things to do were endless. The Arroyos Verdes drink on the breakfast menu was on of the best drinks I had while in Mexico. I also took advantage of the well priced spa treatments they had available.  The massage I received was amazing and the customer service was perfect.  Make sure to make an appointment tho because they fill up fast! This is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy a nice day off =)

197784790.name: Beautiful and Peaceful!
197784790.author: a TripAdvisor user
197784790.reviewBody: Going here for our a little spa get away was amazing! The food was fantastic, as well as, the customer service! The pool was perfect and the amount of places to go was awesome. There was plenty of places to get some sun but also areas that were shaded to cool down! The facility was so peaceful, not noisy at all, and was so beautiful! \n-Danielle G

192634903.name: Beautiful Establishment and Great Entertainment
192634903.author: a TripAdvisor user
192634903.reviewBody: I have taken several trips with my Puerto Vallarta Sister to Los Arroyos Verdes.  The spa services are great, restaurant food is great and it is a wonderful place to take some time to enjoy walking through the gardens to admire the landscaping and decor.  I have seen some great live entertainment by the pool on Sunday afternoons - if you enjoy live saxophone (Bryan Savage) you will want to plan a trip out here.

191736241.name: Anniversary get-away
191736241.author: a TripAdvisor user
191736241.reviewBody: We recently spent the night in the Honeymoon Suite to celebrate our anniversary.  We arrived in the morning, checked in to the huge, comfortable suite with private jacuzzi, patio and upper level deck, and headed to the pool armed with magazines to relax before our couples massage.  The staff is so courteous and attentive, bringing ice water and menus to peruse before slipping away to let us unwind.  Our massages were amazing, professional and soothing...got all the kinks out!!  Back to the poolside for grilled salmon and salad lunch.  We felt so pampered during our entire stay, Renee is an excellent chef with original menus, the staff attended to our every need.  The grounds are lush and well cared for, rooms and public areas clean and eclectic in decor.  We will absolutely be back to enjoy this paradise!  Thank you Lupe!!

189792487.name: A real Gem
189792487.author: a TripAdvisor user
189792487.reviewBody: Wonderful relaxing and friendly accomodating Staff, excellent food at the restaurant and the Spa services are top notch!

188525651.name: We will go back!
188525651.author: a TripAdvisor user
188525651.reviewBody: While staying in La Cruz we went out to Los Arroyos Verdes for breakfast and to spend the day at the pool.  At 4pm we realized we still didn\'t want to leave!  The gardens were fabulous and the pool positively enchanting.  There was young Mexican playing guitar at the pool most of the afternoon and the music was relaxing and lovely.  We will for sure go back!

187115885.name: A little place in Paradise
187115885.author: a TripAdvisor user
187115885.reviewBody: We were recommended here for a massage.  We started our week of vacation with booking a pedicure here to start.  We were so enlightened with this place, we asked for a tour, ate lunch and booked a massage.  The owner approached us and told us to stay and enjoy the afternoon music.  For anyone that likes a quieter, relaxing vacation............this sport is amazing

170372715.name: A Diamond in Bucerias
170372715.author: a TripAdvisor user
170372715.reviewBody:
I just returned from Los Arroyos Verdes. While the property is not located on the beach, they have a very unique pool. Rather than a standard hotel room, these are actual houses. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath with living room, dining room, and kitchen. I loved the natural stone and tiles and decor throughout.

This property is great for families and friends staying together. What a great place to to unwind.

There is so much detail throughout the property with the vegetation and artwork. The owner is very talented. Everywhere I looked, I was amazed by the use of items used to decorate the resort. There is even a sailboat for the kids to explore and enjoy. Or, you can also stay in a mobile home that they rent out. Even bring your own RV. The attention to detail was amazing!

This is a great alternative to the traditional All-Inclusive resorts (especially if you have a large family).

You can even purchase a day pass!

During our stay, they brought in a Sea Lion that performed tricks and swam with a few select children. Everyone enoyed the experience and the Sea Lion seemed very happy!

The Bambu restaurant onsite has a limited schedule, but the food as very fresh. I especially enjoyed the Mango water. Yum! The dining area is in the middle of the pool - something that you don't see all the time.

The hotel offers transportation to the beach area of Bucerias, which is very convenient.

They have bicycles that you can ride around the property, which we enjoyed because we needed to exercise. They also have a workout room (but not air conditioned) and laundry facilities.

The only negative was that we were not able to connect to the Internet, but we couldn't connect at most places.

Hopefully, more people will visit Los Arroyos Verdes and experience this beautiful resort for themselves.

168748100.name: Can\'t-miss lush and tropical hideaway
168748100.author: a TripAdvisor user
168748100.reviewBody:
We've owned a house in Bucerias for many years and we only recently discovered this gem.  It is not only gorgeous but family friendly.  Not having a pool at the house and sometimes needing a break from the beach, we could not have asked for more than a Sunday (their "pool party" day)  spent lounging, swimming and having lunch around their uniquely shaped pool surrounded by incredible attention to artistic detail in the landscaping and ambiance.  

Unusual for this area, they offer vegetarian options on the menu.  Though not a vegetarian myself, I had the portobello mushroom burger which was delicious.  I also really liked the mango water and margaritas.  And they had a kid's menu too!

The service was great, thanks to Julio who happens to speak perfect English for visiting Gringos who don't know Spanish.  Los Arroyos Verdes has a spa on the property which we did not partake in but peeked at the menu for future possibilities. 

This is primarily a lodging facility with villas and rooms scattered around the property but their day pass option for travelers looking for something different and off the beaten path (it's back in the neighborhoods of Bucerias but don't let that deter you) is great.  Am told that if you are staying locally, they will even pick you up and drop you off if you call ahead!

I am thrilled we found this beauty and will be back.

160909518.name: Like a mini-Eden
160909518.author: a TripAdvisor user
160909518.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and quite whimsical spot.  The owners have done an amazing job transforming several acres of previous scrub into a tranquillity inducing oasis.  Apparently it took over 300 person years of effort to accomplish the transformation.  I particularly like the old Airstream trailer that\'s been converted to a rental!  We\'ve been there for a couple of cultural events that included dinner (don\'t bother with the latter); a play and a \'murder mystery\'.  We enjoyed walking the grounds while waiting for our seating.  However, you can see the whole property in 15-20 minutes so I for one would not pay the daily fee that is charged to use the pool and spend the day at Arroyos Verdes.

154593536.name: Beautiful secret
154593536.author: a TripAdvisor user
154593536.reviewBody: An absolutely beautiful get away only 5 minutes from Bucerias. Lush gardens, cute suites, great food, a beautiful pool, friendly staff and a warm, generous owner! This place has it all!\nYou can stay for the day, a week or all year! Come for dinner, a show or just a visit with Lupe.

676194878.name: Crocodile sanctuary Vallarta
676194878.author: a TripAdvisor user
676194878.reviewBody: This was a fantastic and informative tour. We were able to safely get close to a crocodile and we were able to learn so much about the animals and the environment. We would highly recommend this tour in Vallarta \ud83d\ude01\ud83d\ude01.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

675578591.name: Face to face with a crocodile\'s smile!
675578591.author: a TripAdvisor user
675578591.reviewBody:
We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary! The best part about the El Cora tour is that it takes an informative and intelligent approach, as opposed to the usual exploitative crocodile "farm" tour that perpetuates myths and sensationalism. Our guide was well educated and passionate about protecting these endangered creatures. The purpose is to dispel the myths that have led to these creatures being feared and hunted by people.

The sanctuary takes in crocodiles and other animals that have been harmed or displaced by humans. The site adjoins a mangrove wetland where crocodiles that have been rehabilitated are released. The ones that have been too badly injured to survive in the wild are kept in the sanctuary and are included in the tour. These include Esperanza, who was deliberately blinded by her previous owner, and whom we were able to pet. Another crocodile, Bebe, came when the guide called, swimming out from the under the dock to see us.

The tour costs 200 pesos per person and lasts about an hour. The road from the highway is narrow and rough, but it is worth it in the end. We just went with it and took the opportunity to do some birding from the road.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

675028410.name: Great visit with personal guided tour
675028410.author: a TripAdvisor user
675028410.reviewBody: Educational. Fun. Personal. Up close to animals. The vet, Alfredo, led our visit and he was great, answered all the questions we had. Got to touch a real life crocodile! \nBit out in nowhere land. Not a bustling tourist attraction. Really a grassroots operation. Very challenging rough dirt road from highway. Cool to see up close the mangrove swamp, with red coloured crabs scurrying around, see picture below. Paid 200 pesos per person for the tour. Recommend it highly!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

674820814.name: Great Thrill, Very Informative
674820814.author: a TripAdvisor user
674820814.reviewBody: The sanctuary wasn\u2019t easy to get to, as the road to it is a narrow dirt road. Apart from that, it was amazing. You get to touch a huge crocodile, see a wide range of other animals, and learn a lot about the crocodiles. Our guide Alfredo was very informative (but doesn\u2019t overload you with information) and encouraged us to ask any questions. It seems like the sanctuary doesn\u2019t get many visitors, but it\u2019s well worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

674818673.name: Highly Recommend!
674818673.author: a TripAdvisor user
674818673.reviewBody: Just visited today and was shown around by Alfredo. His English was perfect and had a genuine interest in the animals wellbeing and provided very in depth information. Offered to answer any questions and made us feel very welcome. We got to feel an alligator, could not have asked for more. Hope this place survives for many years to come.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

674472814.name: Bike Tour to El Cora "CrocoRide"
674472814.author: a TripAdvisor user
674472814.reviewBody:
One of the highlights of my May 2019 trip was a bike ride tour ("CrocoRide") to the El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary just outside Bucerias / Nuevo Vallarta. A truly unforgettable experience.
The Cycling: Booked the bike tour with BikePlusLife in Nuevo Vallarta. The bikes are exceptionally well maintained and specialized for the varied terrain which is a mix of flat dedicated cycling paths in NV, a short amount of lateral highway road (with a wide cycling shoulder that most cities would be envious of), and then a long and winding back-country dirt road.  The guide, Noemi, clearly enjoys cycling and is so informative about the mangroves and the many different trees and birds in this area, and her enthusiasm made it a fun cycling trip. 
The Sanctuary: the El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary is an unforgettable experience – educational and so engaging, and the creatures are all rescue/sanctuary so not a zoo. The tour was given by Alfredo, a young veterinarian from Guadalajara, with perfect English.  It was fascinating to hear and see live examples of the complex (and sometimes entertaining) connections between the creatures, the tides and the flora in the swamp ecosystem.  And to learn up close and safely about the extraordinary crocodile. It’s not huge, it’s not glittery or animated – but for anyone with curiousity about the world and compassion about nature, and for older kids to be engaged in it – this is a wonderful way to include that in your vacation experiences.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

674272947.name: Great place to see and very educational
674272947.author: a TripAdvisor user
674272947.reviewBody: This was another great find in PV! It\'s not too easy to find...you have to be on the correct side of the street and drive down dirt road. However... it is worth it.
