It\'s not a big place. But the biologist who gave the tour was amazing. Friendly and knowledgable! He sure has a passion for the animals. All animals are very well cared for and loved you can tell. Also, you can even pet the crocs backs. That was pretty darn cool. Worth the trip. I\'d go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

672538236.name: Interesting
672538236.author: a TripAdvisor user
672538236.reviewBody: I went with a friend and glad I got the experience. The drive in was awkward. A really long dirt road but we finally made it to the entrance. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The tour is about 45/1 Hr and you can tell they care about the animals on the property. I did touch the one Croc, Esperanza, but would never do that again. I actually left \'what was I thinking\'. Although I\'m glad I had that experience, it\'s incredibly dangerous. I hope this sanctuary continues to help animals in need.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

672272186.name: R & R
672272186.author: a TripAdvisor user
672272186.reviewBody: I highly recommend El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary.  For all ages, it is educational and engaging. The facility is completely supported by donations and tourism so no government funding at this time.\ud83e\udd1e\nAlfredo, whom is Vet from Guadalajara, gave the tour with much knowledge and enthusiasm.  You can tell he\'s passionate about their purpose there. If you\'re fortunate to be there at the right time, you just may get to hold a baby Crocodile.  Alfredo explained the important connection between the crocodile and the mangrove trees. It was all fascinating in understanding the circle of life and what each creatures purpose is. For only 200 peso highly worth the visit down the long and bumpy dirt road.\nThere are other rescue animals there besides crocodiles,  but their main purpose is to help save and repopulate the Crocodile.  Through education and understanding we can better appreciate this beautiful and intriguing creature.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

669342969.name: Loved petting Experenza!!!
669342969.author: a TripAdvisor user
669342969.reviewBody: We drove to the santuario in our rental car. It was a long dirt road into the place but worth the drive. We had a tour with a knowledgable guide. The animals are all rescues and seem well cared for. Got to pet Espernza the crocodile-that was quite a thrill. Rather sad to learn about the suffering these animals face as a result of human actions and neglect of our environment.\nWould highly recommend this tour. Bring your own refresments as there is very little available on sight.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

668292597.name: Fun and Educational
668292597.author: a TripAdvisor user
668292597.reviewBody: The tour was very interesting and interactive. Our guide Cesar did a wonderful job keeping everyone involved. We were are group of 4 adults and 4 kids ages 4 to 10.  We all enjoyed. It is a little hard to find and there is a long dirt road to get to the sanctuary, However it is a unique experience and worth the effort.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

667602156.name: Great place with a cause!
667602156.author: a TripAdvisor user
667602156.reviewBody: Saw this place on the internet looking for an activity, took a cab (rip-off)with my girlfriend. Our host \u201cCesar\u201d happily greeted us with an introduction to the place and then took us on our tour. Learned about the crocodile and their habitat even managing to get up close and touching one. Juan the goat, a coupe talking birds and a couple other animals rounded out visit making it a fun hour or so. Highly recommend going there, just north of  pv about 20 mins. They are relatively new and are providing a sort of rehab sanctuary to many rescued animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

667019379.name: Off the beaten track (literally) but well worth the effort
667019379.author: a TripAdvisor user
667019379.reviewBody:
Small crocodile sanctuary off the main highway along a very bumpy dirt track but worth the effort. Right in the middle of a mangrove swamp the very informative guide (Caesar) told us all about crocodiles and what they are really like.

Takes only about 1 hour but is quite cheap at just 200 pesos for adults and 100 for children. You get to handle the baby crocodiles and get very close to a variety of other animals there. 

Chester zoo it ain’t, but it’s a great way to spend an hour or so. 

They will call a taxi for you to take yum back afterwards. No big deal. Read some horror stories about taxis and asking they to wait.  Not an issue....they called and we waited 10-15 mins for our ride home.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

666493530.name: Wonderful Tour
666493530.author: a TripAdvisor user
666493530.reviewBody: We stumbled across this place but what a find.  It was quiet so we had a personal tour and it was so informative.  We got to touch a baby and adult crocodile!  We also learnt about the importance of the mangrove trees to the environment. Such a fun time.  They rely on tourism to help fund the sanctuary, so please go visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

665611391.name: Very informative and interesting
665611391.author: a TripAdvisor user
665611391.reviewBody: This was a wonderful tour that would be of interest to all ages.   It really makes you think about crocodiles in a different light.   Alfredo was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

665525358.name: Great place to visit
665525358.author: a TripAdvisor user
665525358.reviewBody: Just visited El Coro this morning, our guide Alfredo was so informative and passionate about the conservation work they do. Really enjoyed our tour ... we learnt so much about crocodiles and the environment. Your taxi driver will need to stay with you to bring you back, ours had never been there before so Alfredo invited him to join us... cannot recommend this place enough , well worth the entrance fee and great to know that your contribution helps them continue their work as they have no other funding!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

665268756.name: Pet a Crocodile, Learn about Animals, and Save the Environment
665268756.author: a TripAdvisor user
665268756.reviewBody: We needed a day out of the sun and this sweet refuge exceeded expectations. We went with four adults and three kids, ages 6, 9 and 11.  We all loved it and learned a lot. This group of young scientists and conversationalists clearly have a deep passion for the animals they serve and the surrounding habitat. They are working to purchase additional lands to protect this fragile area. The ticket fees go toward these efforts and we were more than happy to pay the fees to support this important effort and have an amazing day learning about local animals and event getting to pet a young crocodile!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

665157466.name: Educational Gem
665157466.author: a TripAdvisor user
665157466.reviewBody: Took our family of 6 (ages 26 - 80) thru this awesome animal sanctuary.  Informative & fascinating.  A bit off the beaten path but well worth the visit. \nAlfredo was our guide. He was articulate, educated & entertaining with a fun personality.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

664334792.name: Amazing tour!
664334792.author: a TripAdvisor user
664334792.reviewBody: Ceasar is a marine biologist and an amazing tour guide. Such an interesting and educational tour. Unforgettable experience. My ten and five year old had an amazing time too. Well worth the money. I paid more to such a good cause!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

664245016.name: Worth the effort!!
664245016.author: a TripAdvisor user
664245016.reviewBody: We were in Bucerias for Spring Break and were lucky enough to discover El Cora!  My kids both said that it was one of their favourite things about the trip.  Caesar (Czar?!) was our guide and was great, he was very informative and passionate about his work.  Would highly recommend a visit to El Cora!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

663449551.name: Must See
663449551.author: a TripAdvisor user
663449551.reviewBody: I don\'t really know what to say other than this was one of my most favorite outings, that I have ever been on. The tour itself, is very low key, and casual. Our guide Cesar was engaging, and knowledgable. The tour itself, lasts about an hour, and the cost is $200 pesos. You will learn a lot about crocodiles, the eco system, and even see a few other animals. No matter your age, you will love the sanctuary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

660565174.name: Fun and educational family experience
660565174.author: a TripAdvisor user
660565174.reviewBody: We saw a crocodile in the river on the way to the sanctuary and then saw several inside as well. Cesar was a great guide and taught our children many things about the species along with the local ecosystem. The mangrove with all the wildlife is stunning. We even saw a wild baby croc walk to the river across from us. A very memorable time!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

659722766.name: A unique experience
659722766.author: a TripAdvisor user
659722766.reviewBody: I spent a weekend in Puerto Vallarta and found this place in TripAdvisor. It is totally recommended since it will be a unique experience for everybody to come so close in touch with crocodiles. The tour was very interesting and they also have other animals to see. Be aware that the trip is really in bad condition. Bet is to negotiate with your driver to wait for you and to bring you back as well.I took Uber and it worked perfectly. Tour is 200 MXN but it is recommended to give a tip to support their project. Just great!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

658491053.name: Great experience for anyone
658491053.author: a TripAdvisor user
658491053.reviewBody: Don\u2019t be put off by the bumpy gravel road into the sanctuary. It\u2019s 15 Minutes from the highway but totally worthwhile. We were greeted by a biologist named Caesar who gave us an hour of non stop well informed information about the crocodiles, the mangroves, the creatures of the area and the amazing work the facilty does to return wildlife to its habitat whenever possible. We held a young crocodile and a baby turtle. Petted a peconi and a coutamungo. Learned lots and need to go back for a refresher! Great activity takes  full hour plus travel time and well worth the 200 pesos per person.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

658283146.name: Highlight of my vacation!
658283146.author: a TripAdvisor user
658283146.reviewBody: They are doing great work here helping endangered & injured animals & ecosystems. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and love animals! There are several crocodiles of different sizes & ages, along with a number of other delightful animals. We will definitely return next time we are in the area!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

657653891.name: A must!
657653891.author: a TripAdvisor user
657653891.reviewBody: I had high expectations for this place based on reviews I read, and they were exceeded by my visit to El Cora. Well worth the twenty dollar cab ride from Sayulita, we received a fascinating, informative, and delightful tour from C\u00e9sar in perfect English. We saw many crocodiles of different ages and sizes, got to pet a baby crocodile, a goat, and the world\'s friendliest coati, and learned a lot about both the animals and the endangered mangrove ecosystem. The lush, peaceful environment is a welcomed reprieve from the crowds of tourists in Sayulita, and you can feel good about supporting a grassroots organization working to save their beautiful local habitats and creatures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

657650799.name: Amazing!
657650799.author: a TripAdvisor user
657650799.reviewBody: We had a fabulous time. Our visit was educational as well as interactive, and it\'s great to be able to support the preservation of local endangered species and ecosystems. Our guide Ceasar was  extremely knowledgeable and gave us a great tour in English. Absolutely worth the taxi from Sayulita.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

657367041.name: Well worth the visit
657367041.author: a TripAdvisor user
657367041.reviewBody: We visited as two couples, and really enjoyed the informative tour of the preserve.  The people working there (A biologist and a veterinarian when we were there) obviously really care for animals and are passionate about explaining what is happening to their habitat. Their knowledge is excellent, the tour was a nice slow pace. The crocodiles and other animals are just amazing and gave us a whole new perspective on these beautiful creatures. The road in is quite rough, and the facility is rustic, but so much heart is being put into their efforts I absolutely recommend visiting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

656052141.name: Amazing experience!
656052141.author: a TripAdvisor user
656052141.reviewBody: I just recently spend a week around Puerta Vallarta. Having a tour of the sanctuary was definitely the highlight of the trip! Our tour guide C\u00e9sar was very knowledgeable and extremely passionate about the animals. As well as the preservation of the habitats they live in. All the animals there are rescued or being rehabilitated. It is a smaller, up close and personal experience with all of the animals. If you are in the area I would highly recommend visiting and going for a tour. Very good price for the experience. Definitely watch for the signs as they are easy to miss!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

656037213.name: Educational, amazing place!
656037213.author: a TripAdvisor user
656037213.reviewBody: Absolutely amazing place! It was great getting up close and personal with the crocs and other animals which are there. Our guide, C\u00e8sar, was the best! Very knowledgeable and taught us so much about the crocs and how important the mangrove ecosystem is. Highly recommend going if you are in PV! \nThanks to the guides for the work you all do for the crocs and other rescue animals!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

655910810.name: Educational, Fun and helping the local Crocs
655910810.author: a TripAdvisor user
655910810.reviewBody: Glad we took the time (including the long dirt road) to visit.  The guide was very knowledgeable and kept the tour interesting for the whole group.  NOTE: super easy to miss the sign on Hwy 200

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

654842296.name: very nice and informational park
654842296.author: a TripAdvisor user
654842296.reviewBody:
one has to be careful not to miss the road turning from the main road for it's small. 
at the entrance lots of vultures were greeting. 
even though I was the only person showing up, I had a tour. The guide told me lots of interesting things I never heard of before. I got very close to the crocodiles, which I lied very much. 
They also have some other animals which are rescued. 
what I like is that they also have school teachings and want to educate the people living here so that they better understand the biosphere and also lose there fear of crocodiles. 
If I ever came back to this place I'd visit this park again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

654541941.name: Knowledgeable Guide & Up close and Personal
654541941.author: a TripAdvisor user
654541941.reviewBody:
We were looking for a day trip that was not with a tour company and stumbled upon the crocodile sanctuary. It was one of the best day trips that we could have stumbled on! Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and funny. He made learning fun! We were able to get up close and personal with one of the crocodiles and actually pet her with no tape on her mouth and no barrier at all. Got my heart racing for sure but it was worth it. It's a bit of a drive from Puerto Vallarta, so sit back and enjoy the scenery. 

We took an Uber from Puerto Vallarta. Cost us $374 pesos (about $20 US). Very clean and comfortable. Don't use a taxi. You'll pay double that amount. Make sure you tell the guide you don't want a taxi to return home (they'll call one for you and then you're stuck haggling a price with the taxi).

We're a family of 4 (teen boys 18 & 15). Everyone enjoyed it. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

653596742.name: Our visit to El Coro
653596742.author: a TripAdvisor user
653596742.reviewBody: Fabulous experience. Excellent guide.\nVery worthwhile to support this fabulous sanctuary . I would definitely recommend \nEl Coro to all interested in this wonderful sanctuary and seeing first hand this important mission.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

653557456.name: Amazing and educational
653557456.author: a TripAdvisor user
653557456.reviewBody: We toured the crocodile sanctuary with our kids. The guide (Caesar) was very informative and really promoted the work that they were trying to do to rebuild and protect the local wildlife populations; and not just the crocodiles but also peccary (wild boars), terrapins, codimundi, and others. We were even able to get up close to some of the recused crocodiles and even able to pet a baby one. \n\nThe road to get to it is long and isn\u2019t in the best of condition but once you\u2019re there it\u2019s worth the drive. Highly recommend checking it out

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

653080848.name: An amazing and inspiring place! \ud83d\udc0a
653080848.author: a TripAdvisor user
653080848.reviewBody: Go visit this incredible sanctuary and support their inspiring and important work protecting crocodiles and their fragile mangrove ecosystem in Puerto Vallarta!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

653034482.name: Very educational
653034482.author: a TripAdvisor user
653034482.reviewBody: Took the kids to do something a little different other then swimming. The tour was an hour and very educational. We learnt about the Mangrove forest, crocodiles, we got to touch one that was blind. I highly recommend going. The cost is 200 pecos and 100 for kids. The money goes back to the sanctuary and all the good work they do taking care for the animals

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

652079284.name: Our planet
652079284.author: a TripAdvisor user
652079284.reviewBody: I was surprised to learn , just how important the role a crocodile plays in the balance of nature. In an epoch where humans are destroying the planet , there are those hard at work in trying to preserve a balance . If one ventures out to places like this and away from the resorts, which are HUGE perpetrators of wasted plastics and more, one will gain an appreciation of nature and therefore adjust ones own attitudes and habits to do your part how ever small to help preserve whats left and what we leave behind for future generations.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

650750461.name: Excellent
650750461.author: a TripAdvisor user
650750461.reviewBody: Definately a must! The work they do is extraordinary so all the help they get is more than deserved. The tour is done by either the vet or a biologist. They\'ll teach you all you want to know about the species in Puerto Vallarta. Would love to visit them again when back in the area

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

650379042.name: Exceptional!
650379042.author: a TripAdvisor user
650379042.reviewBody: I booked the Bike + Life cocoride tour and road a mountain bike here with my guide Noemi.   The bike ride was awesome, first on nice roads in Riviera Nayarit and then on a dirt road through the mangroves.   Way better experience than a taxi or driving.  Alfredo gave us an informative tour, and we were allowed to pet Esperanza, a crocodile and other wild local animals.  Amazing and highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

649921161.name: A Nice Discovery
649921161.author: a TripAdvisor user
649921161.reviewBody:
We took a guided tour and we did not regret it. 
The guide was very sympatic, he kindly answered all of our questions and gave us many interesting info.
We have learned a lot about crocos and their important role in nature and we also had the chance to touch and get very close of some animals.

And on the top of that the entry fee helps support the sanctuary and a good cause, so there is no excuse to not stop there for a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

648528154.name: Learned a lot and loved our visit here
648528154.author: a TripAdvisor user
648528154.reviewBody: Our visit was better than we had hoped for.  We learned so  much about crocodiles and other animals as well (there are more than just crocodiles there).  Alfredo was a fantastic guide.  He toured us through the place for over an hour teaching us about the animals and answering all our questions.  We were the only ones there so we had his undivided attention.  \n\nIt is about 3 km\'s off the highway so we negotiated a price with our taxi driver to drive us there and wait for us.  The 200 peso\'s per person for admission was well worth it and it goes to supporting the sanctuary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

647834281.name: Fun afternoon
647834281.author: a TripAdvisor user
647834281.reviewBody: We got a private tour by Alfredo. He is a student learning about veterinary medicine at the sanctuary. He was very knowledgeable and we learned a lot about the ecosystem and animals of the area. I highly recommend this place. They exist only off the small entry fee of $200 pesos or about $10. The road is long and not well maintained but still worth the trip. Uber dropped us off but we didn\u2019t have enough cell service to call one to leave so they call us a taxi.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

646812786.name: Really enjoyed our visit.
646812786.author: a TripAdvisor user
646812786.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed our tour and learnt a lot. It is not just crocodiles. It was quiet and the two guides did an excellent job. You entry fee helps support a good cause.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

646065778.name: A highlight of our trip
646065778.author: a TripAdvisor user
646065778.reviewBody: We were the only visitors there at the time (on Sunday morning around 11 a.m.) and Alfredo spent over an hour giving us a personal tour. He is a veterinarian and gave the tour in English, but was also happy to answer my questions about how to say things in Spanish. He is clearly passionate about crocodiles and other animals, and had lots of great information about how the sanctuary is working to protect animals and educate the community. Like others have said, they will help you safely touch many of the animals, and you can even enter the enclosure with one very well-trained crocodile (Esperanza) if you want. And at 200 pesos per person (about $10 USD) it\'s an amazing deal.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

645809915.name: Highly recommended
645809915.author: a TripAdvisor user
645809915.reviewBody: The tour takes about 1 hour and you will learn a lot of things about crocodiles. You can go inside the cage to take pictures with a blind crocodile, they will also let you touch baby-crocodiles. There are also many other animals that you can touch, for example hawks, collared peccaries, goats and dead spiders. It\'s really worth taking the tour!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

645623279.name: Great visit
645623279.author: a TripAdvisor user
645623279.reviewBody: Had a great trip here with the bike plus life tour. Cesar was our guide and was very knowledgeable and you can tell he cared about all the rescued crocodiles. My young daughter was able to stroke a crocodile and he made her feel very comfortable doing so. Definitely worth an hour out of your life.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

645210075.name: Very interactive, interesting & educational
645210075.author: a TripAdvisor user
645210075.reviewBody: Our guide, Cesar, a marine biologist, welcomed us and gave us an overview of the Sanctuary\'s history and objectives. He also dispelled some myths about crocs and our perceptions of them. The rest of our hour there was spent on seeing (and petting) the various species housed there, from crocs and turtles to Macaws, Coatis, and Mountain goats. We were also able to observe some of the bird species in the Mango forest.\nAltogether, a totally unique and educational experience. Our cab ride from Bucerias was $250 pesos and the driver waited for us for an extra $100 pesos, so round trip the cost was $600 pesos. Highly recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

644934802.name: Wonderful sanctuary
644934802.author: a TripAdvisor user
644934802.reviewBody: My teenagers, husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the sanctuary.  Alfredo was a perfect docent who clearly loves his job and loves teaching others about the animals.  We were also impressed that they are working with local schools to teach the importance of crocodiles in their natural habitat.  We highly recommend a visit to the sanctuary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

644850384.name: Highly recommend a visit!
644850384.author: a TripAdvisor user
644850384.reviewBody: This is a hidden gem. Very reasonably priced. Tour was conducted by a biologist who was very personable and knowledgeable. Cab driver knew where to go although had never been before. It was a rainy day so was surprisingly busy. Recommended if you want something off the beaten path!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

643099435.name: Interesting AND fun
643099435.author: a TripAdvisor user
643099435.reviewBody: We highly recommend this place. Our guide was very knowledgeable and genuinely cared for the animals, his English was excellent. We learned a lot about animals that are native to this area of Mexico, and the problems they have to deal with because of humans. We  petted a little crocodile, 14 months old, about 18 inches long. The handler had a nip on his finger, but he was holding the mouth closed so we were in no danger of being bitten. It was interesting to learn about the individuality of each animal. Great place to visit!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

642910500.name: Excellent Experience at Santuario de Cocodrilos El Cora
642910500.author: a TripAdvisor user
642910500.reviewBody: It is a long dirt road heading to the Crocodile Sanctuary and we were not sure what to expect.  What we found was an incredibly enriching experience with a wonderful guide (Alfredo).   Alfredo is bi-lingual and a veterinarian by training.  He explained along each step of the visit about crocodiles, their habitats, how they live, how long they live (more than 80 years).  We were able to touch the crocodiles and appreciate them.  They also have other local animals that we were able to visit and learn about.  We had 4 children with us, ages 6-9, and they were completely captivated the entire time.  The animals are well cared for and you can tell that they live well.  A great way to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

642433081.name: Must go
642433081.author: a TripAdvisor user
642433081.reviewBody: This place is amazing.  It was a restaurant before and now the two owners turned it into a animal sanctuary.  It\u2019s only been in business for a month.  The veterinarian is so knowledgeable.  We were educated so much and kid had splendid time.  The road to it is a bit rough and so taxi may be pricier.  We took Uber which was way cheaper compared to taxi.  It\u2019s a must go!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

642280378.name: Go Here !
642280378.author: a TripAdvisor user
642280378.reviewBody: Lovely people with great affinity for wildlife ... they help, save, rehome, the local wildlife... especially crocodiles... they\u2019ve just taken over the sanctuary and need as many people as possible to visit so that they can care for these animals. We all got to touch a crocodile which was amazing and we all learned so much about this misunderstood creature. Well done to this fantastic team !!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

642175540.name: Great place with so much potential
642175540.author: a TripAdvisor user
642175540.reviewBody: I found this place on Google maps and it piqued my curiosity. We were not disappointed.  Our guide was a marine biologist who plans to transform the place into an animal rescue/ crocodile breeding program. The tour was very informative, I would recommend this to anyone.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

641509810.name: New owners, new project (6 months old), true Sanctuary
641509810.author: a TripAdvisor user
641509810.reviewBody:
Two young men with great animal conservation ideas and environment concerns are taking a big bet here. A veterinarian and a marine biologist have decided to give this place a new breath. They are putting all their time, energy and money to make it a true sanctuary for rescued animals that can’t be released into the wild, mainly crocodiles but not only. They also want to turn the place into a crocodile breeding farm.
They give you the tour of the property and it’s guests, which most of them you can pet!
You will learn a LOT here about crocodiles.
The access road is long and in a rough condition. Please, be courageous and drive to the end of it, you won’t be deceived.
Those two young men would also need founding to turn this wild access into a proper road, and to finish refurbishing the whole property that was left unmaintained for too long before they took it... They have faith and the entrance is lonely 200 pesos, feel free to donate more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

640490194.name: Loved it
640490194.author: a TripAdvisor user
640490194.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our visit. The guide was very informative and we all learned a lot about crocodiles.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

640425982.name: Up close and personal
640425982.author: a TripAdvisor user
640425982.reviewBody: Decided to visit on the spur of the moment and glad we did. Did have some doubts (and I\u2019m sure our taxi driver did too) as it\u2019s a long way up an unmade road. But don\u2019t be put off. We received a friendly welcome and then had a guided tour from Cesar, a marine biologist, who is very enthusiastic about conserving Mexican wildlife and habitats. They do not have loads of captive animals there (though plenty in the mangrove swamp) but we were able to go into the enclosure with a big crocodile and see the other animals up close, including feeding banana to the coati. \nThe centre relies on tours for its funding and 200 pesos seemed well worth it. They are working hard to improve the centre but I hope this doesn\u2019t mean they lose the personal touch. Would definitely recommend a visit but be prepared for the road (getting the taxi for a round trip was a good idea)..

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

638923477.name: Repeat Visit even better
638923477.author: a TripAdvisor user
638923477.reviewBody: We wanted to show our daughter the sanctuary as she wasn\'twith us last year. There were immense improvements to the sidewalks and enclosures. The tour guide was excellent and spoke fluent English. The road was still a challenge but the bigger Nissan cars can can make it through. Recommend you tip your driver well as he to wash their car after. \nOur driver Adam is the best! \nHe suggested maybe they could offer quad rides in as an added attraction. We think that is a good idea as long as its fenced from gators.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

636600755.name: Highlight of our trip
636600755.author: a TripAdvisor user
636600755.reviewBody: The El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary was the highlight of our recent trip to Mexico. We were able to get right up close with some of the crocs and learn a lot about them and their natural environment. The new owners (who took over in spring 2018) are clearly passionate about educating people and helping protect these amazing reptiles. The tour was only about 30 minutes, always interesting, and we even got to touch a baby croc! There are a few other animals there too (birds, goats, coati), but of course the main attraction is the crocodiles. (Don\'t worry--the other animals are part of the family, not feed stock for the crocs!) This is a worthwhile trip for adults and kids alike. The only caution is the road going in: it\'s in pretty rough shape, but workers were already putting down new gravel while we were there, so I doubt that will be an ongoing problem. There are also some renovations going on at the sanctuary itself, so it will likely be even better when we come back next year.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

633235114.name: Incredible!
633235114.author: a TripAdvisor user
633235114.reviewBody: Reuben and Hector were incredible!  The tour they gave us was informative and fun. They were wonderful with our children and allowed them to interact wit the animals and ask many questions. They are both incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about crocs and all local wildlife and its preservation. Everyone should come and visit this fantastic facility!  Gracias!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

632049234.name: Excellent small sanctuary
632049234.author: a TripAdvisor user
632049234.reviewBody: We had a private tour as we were the only ones there. The biologist was very informative and his English was very good.   The tour was slightly more than one hour with more than crocodiles.  The mangrove is unspoiled so close to the built up areas.  Admission was 200 peso a person,  taxi was 500 round trip plus a tip for waiting. The road in is very rough and would be a challenge to walk.  Use a taxi for sure.   They responded to a Facebook message early the following morning after asking.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

630150741.name: Excellent!!
630150741.author: a TripAdvisor user
630150741.reviewBody: Incredible experience, our guide Caesar is a very knowledgeable biologist, animals are well cared for. Fantastic trip for anyone who wants to learn more about crocodiles, other local animals and the enviroment they live in. This santuary does a really good job looking after and protecting these animals. We will come back again!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

629696940.name: So amazing
629696940.author: a TripAdvisor user
629696940.reviewBody: This was an amazing tour to take and I would like to recommend it a thousand times over. Not only is it a super cool place to visit, but they teach you all kinds of things about crocodiles and the eco system. I learned way more than I was expecting and have a new found love for crocodiles. They do amazing things here and all the money from the tour goes to helping take care of the animals there which I absolutely love. OH, and, I got to pet a crocodile and hold a smaller one... so there\'s the story of a lifetime right there!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

629237741.name: Amazing Place
629237741.author: a TripAdvisor user
629237741.reviewBody: Thoroughly recommend this place the staff are passionate about the work they do there you get to meet the crocodiles and learn about them and their habitat, although the site is basic we all left with a greater understanding and respect for them and the cruelty that we inflict on them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

625945600.name: Crocodile
625945600.author: a TripAdvisor user
625945600.reviewBody: Just come back from sanctuaries de cocodrilos el Cora what a fantastic way to see crocodiles and get up close to them.Taxi took us there and waited for us, and the tour guide was brilliant we got to hold a baby cocodrile.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

624152129.name: Worth a trip!
624152129.author: a TripAdvisor user
624152129.reviewBody:
My boyfriend and I came just over a week ago. E were on an all inclusive holiday for 2 weeks with 3 excursions and were itching to get out of the hotel! I’d heard about this place so had a little google and we decided to give it a go! 

Our hotel was about a 15/20min drive away and our taxi driver charged us 600 pesos as it’s not easy for them to get to they wait while you go round. Our taxi driver told us loads on the way there, what to expect and even pointed out the wildlife on the way there!

Once we got to the sanctuary we were met by 2 guys who were so friendly (can’t remember their names though :( ) they offered us water and bug spray. Seriously take the bug spray!! I coated myself in the stuff and still went home with 3 bites! 

We got a little tour of the sanctuary where we saw 5 crocodiles, 2 were blind so were unable to be released back in the wild. We saw a couple of other animals too and our tour guide was very informative. Any question we had he had the answer to. Learnt so much! 

At the end we got to see some eggs and skulls of crocodiles. We even got to see their biggest croc being fed that was quite an experience.

Last off we got the chance to hold a baby crocodile. I’ve never been anywhere else where you can get that experience. To be that close and have the chance to hold one! 

It cost 200 pesos each and then you could give a donation too. So glad we did it! All our friends and family were envious of us!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

616755367.name: This place is a must
616755367.author: a TripAdvisor user
616755367.reviewBody: If you enjoy wild life and nature, visiting this place is a must, staff is great and well educated in the subject and the tour and experience is just amazing, highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

611669967.name: Cool wildlife refuge tour
611669967.author: a TripAdvisor user
611669967.reviewBody: Small little refuge smack in the center of Nuevo Vallarta. Its quaint and the road is not the best from the main road especially in the monsoon season. Having said that, the staff is very kind and knowledgeable. The guide was fun. You\u2019ll get to hold a little crocodile and learn much about the local wilderness. Enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

609267031.name: Very educational
609267031.author: a TripAdvisor user
609267031.reviewBody: We had a great visit learning about crocodiles.  Although there weren\u2019t many, the vet who conducted the tour was very engaging and made it fun and very educational.  There are also goats, turtles, and other animals.  It\u2019s not long so it\u2019s perfect for kids.  They even let us hold a young crocodile! They showed us crocodile eggs, skulls, vertebrae, very interesting!  \nOne con is that It\u2019s not easy to get there if you don\u2019t have your own car.  We took an Uber and the driver happened to know about it, but on the return no Uber was available to pick us up, so we had to google a taxi nearby and it was much more expensive than the Uber but that was the only option.  Also, bring cash because they don\u2019t take credit cards.  They\u2019ll take US dollars but at a le exchange rate.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

608791372.name: A hidden gem of a tour
608791372.author: a TripAdvisor user
608791372.reviewBody: This was an amazing tour and an amazing story.  We spent over an hour with Caesar who explained the story behind the location and the history of the lovely animals that they have there. We stood in the cage with a crocodile that was about 3.5M long and we also held a baby one in our hands. AMAZING! The venue does need some attention but when you hear the back story you will appreciate how well they have done.  I would strongly recommend this authentic tour which we only found out by accident.  All the money they get from the very reasonable priced ticked goes back to supporting the environmental efforts.  PLEASE VISIT THIS TOUR!  They need all the support that they can get.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

607127372.name: Awesome
607127372.author: a TripAdvisor user
607127372.reviewBody: We absolutely loved this. We toured for an hour with Caesar and loved seeing and touching crocodiles, the most pristine mangroves,  and the ecological work they are doing. We afterwards went for lunch at Boca de tomates and saw the wild crocs on the bumpy road down with fresh eyes. This is not for people wanting a Disney experience but for those wanting to understand and experience real Mexico..... highlight of our trip ... Everyone we met there were Mexican or European not sure why.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

601889212.name: Best Tour Ever! Very Grateful for Experience.
601889212.author: a TripAdvisor user
601889212.reviewBody: So grateful for Ceasar and his team for educating us as well as doing so much to save this endangered American Crocodile species. Take your kids! Try to arrive close to the hour as the tours run hourly. \nTours are in English and Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

600929828.name: They tried hard, but it wasn\'t fun
600929828.author: a TripAdvisor user
600929828.reviewBody: Ceaser tried his hardest, but the place was really small, hot, one had to wait for a tour, and if you speak only English, you get very, very little compared to the Spanish speakers. Really enjoyed the Zoo much better - we even left early.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

597190452.name: Hidden gem in Vallarta
597190452.author: a TripAdvisor user
597190452.reviewBody:
Visited the sanctuary today and had a great time. Our guide was very knowledgeable on all the surroundings and animals that live there. You will learn lots about not just crocs but mangrove crabs, herons, egrets and all the other wildlife that lives in the area. You get to get up close with crocs, from the 3 year old babies to the 8 foot Esmeralda and we got to see the 4 metre India being fed as well. Not your typical tourist attraction but if you want something different on your Mexico holiday this is the place to go. Ran by people who really care about their local area and the flora and fauna that surround it. Allow 1 1/2 to 2 hours to do the tour.
A couple of tips, make sure your cab driver knows where he is going as it's 2km down a dirt road and I can see some refusing to drive it ( our driver volunteered to wait for us which was a big help). Also they sell mosquito repellent which seems to work, buy the big bottle straight away (about £3) and cover yourself in it as there are hundreds of them. If you want to do the boat trip send a message before to find out the tides, then they can let you know if the water is suitable for a boat trip or not and what times to come. We didn't do this and missed out but it looks like it would be a great experience.
All in all a great day if you're into wildlife

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

596233429.name: Cocorillos
596233429.author: a TripAdvisor user
596233429.reviewBody: Well it was fun. It\'s a guided tour of a little piece of land. They have been open for 2 years and it seems its a young group of 3 kids. A vet and 2 biologists who are giving back to the world. it\'s very informative and fun. We got to hold a baby croc and a little turtle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

588967841.name: Crocodile Heaven
588967841.author: a TripAdvisor user
588967841.reviewBody:
We visited the Crocodile Santutuary last week, we took a taxi down a long dirt track, past some vultures sitting on a signpost.  Once there we was greeted by Ceasar.  We asked our taxi driver to join my husband, our four year old daughter and I.  We had our own private tour. 

Ceasar is a marine biologist and truly cares for the animals he looks after.  We saw crocodile, turtles, goats, warthogs and lots more.  My highlight was walking out on to a platform in the mangroves.  I could have stayed there watching the world go by all day. 

We all got to hold a three year old crocodile.  Which we will all remember forever, especially our taxi driver.

This was one of the best things we saw in Mexico and we would highly recommend a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

587043478.name: Wonderful and informative!
587043478.author: a TripAdvisor user
587043478.reviewBody: Cesar is a passionate and animated tour guide who clearly believes in what he does.  We were the last tour of the day (at 4pm), but it became a private tour, so that was even better.  We took the tour in Spanish, but it appears Cesar is fluent in English also. Yes, the road is a 20 minute potholed nightmare -- even worse than the roads I\'ve driven in Costa Rica, and that\'s saying something!  However, this is the least touristy thing you\'ll ever do in Nuevo Vallarta, and is absolutely worth your time and effort to get there :-)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

583996272.name: Awesome time!!!
583996272.author: a TripAdvisor user
583996272.reviewBody: Caesar is the new Crocodile Dundee of Mexico!  The road in is a bit sketchy but no big deal in the rental car. Our Passat transformed into a Jeep rubicon and handled the dirt road with no difficulty.  For 200 pesos each Caesar, who is a marine biologist, gave our family an hour tour through the animal rehabilitation facility. He answered all of our questions with skill. I would go back in a heartbeat. Besides we all got to hold a three year old crocodile that snuggled up to my daughter! This guy clearly loves all of the animals in his care! Everyone in our group thought it was the best part of the week!!!! Give him a big tip!  He deserves it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

583506993.name: Fun and informative
583506993.author: a TripAdvisor user
583506993.reviewBody: We enjoyed this attraction very much. The interpretive guide was very friendly and informative. Give them a call, they might even pick you up from your home, resort or hotel.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

580415064.name: Very cool "untouristy" and informative
580415064.author: a TripAdvisor user
580415064.reviewBody: This was listed as one of the top ten things to do in Nuevo Vallarta and I couldn\'t pass up a chance to hold a baby crocodile so off we went.  This will come with warnings to anyone who is thinking of going, so be prepared.  After a frustrating try at using Uber, we decided to just grab a taxi.  It was only maybe 3 km from where we were staying so we got into a cab.  Getting off the main road (200), we followed some scant signage and drove maybe a kilometer or two down a really bumpy road through the jungle.  Good thing it was the dry season and you\'d probably get stuck on this road if it was wet.  The taxi driver wasn\'t impressed but of good humour as I kept apologizing for the road, like it was my fault, lol.  Got to an arrow pointing left so we assumed we were going in the right direction.  When we got there, we found out it had tour times and we had to wait maybe 20 or 30 minutes.  There was another taxi driver there waiting for his fair to finish their tour because you can\'t call a taxi to come get you from there..they don\'t come pick you up at this place!!!!  In other words, if you come in a taxi, the driver has to wait for you and this will take an hour! Luckily, our taxi driver was at the end of his shift so he just had to call into dispatch and let them know he\'d be another hour or so bringing the cab back.  He was lovely and didn\'t mind waiting in their nice shady hut and of course I told him he\'d be getting a nice tip and the 6 pack of beer I had in my fridge at the end of it, lol.  He seemed happy with that!  Oh, and he only charged us for the ride there and back, not for waiting.  We told him we\'d be happy to bring him on the tour but he said he was fine and didn\'t like crocodiles that much anyway, lol.  So, this is a sanctuary where they rescue injured crocodiles mostly and an assortment of other animals like parrots and goats, etc. who could not survive in the wild.  I know that seems weird to many people in Mexico as there are so many crocodiles there and not looked upon with affection!  It was high tide so we didn\'t see any swimming around but did get to visit ones that were on land, even going into one of the pens with one (I kept a little distance!).  The guide was very informative and the price was reasonable (200 peso\'s each) and plus we liked the fact that the money was going to a good cause.  It\'s not a showy attraction if that\'s what you\'re looking for but enjoyable and informative, plus we did get to hold a baby crocodile and got some good pictures.  Just go prepared regarding the ride there and back and know that even though it says it\'s open at 11:00, you will be going on a tour which is timed so you may have to wait a few minutes or even up to an hour if you just missed the tour ahead of you.  Our tour began at 1:00 and it was a Sunday afternoon with only 3 of us there.  No need for me to go back but it\'s a cool thing to experience and for a good cause.  Just come knowing about the ride and the road and the poor signage :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

579549917.name: Small and perfect \ud83d\udc4c\ud83c\udffe
579549917.author: a TripAdvisor user
579549917.reviewBody: I enjoyed my visit here and came up close and personal with crocodiles and learned some informative information and it was only $14 for the tour very cheap and going towards a great cause feeding the wonderful animals here I would visit again and recommend a visit the tour guide interacted well with the animals

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

575932340.name: A sanctuary for animals and an interactive experience of pure connection to them
575932340.author: a TripAdvisor user
575932340.reviewBody: This tour was excellent!!!! I had never touched a crocodile or snake before today. It was incredible to experience the connection to the animals through touch. Thank you Cesar, for your knowledge and the way your love for animals is healing. Love has a ripple effect. Thank you so so much for how you engaged with my son. He wants to come back and he wants to think of a way to donate to the McCaw and the animal that was like a raccoon/ badger guy. \n\nI also want to add that at times I wanted to capture our experience with a photo - but my instincts said to stay completely present with the animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

574221892.name: An interesting and informative way to spend an hour
574221892.author: a TripAdvisor user
574221892.reviewBody: We were staying in Nuevo Vallarta for a few days so hired a car to take us to Bucerias to see this crocodile sanctuary, based on all of the great Trip Advisor reviews. We were really glad we went, it was one of the highlights of our trip! Our guide, Cesar, is a marine biologist and he was wonderful. He provided great detail about the work he and his two other teammates (apparently there are really only three of them keeping this place going!) are doing at the sanctuary, and gave us many of interesting facts about the crocodiles in the sanctuary as well as an overview of the way ongoing land development is impacting the ecosystem in the area. We were all enthralled (my husband and I and our two daughters.)  As others have said, this is NOT an easy place to get to so it was well worth hiring a guide to drive us there -- and then we went into downtown Bucerias after that to check out the main plaza/get some ice cream. All in all, a wonderful way to spend a few hours off the beaten track.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

572318743.name: Close encounter with crocodiles - worth to see !
572318743.author: a TripAdvisor user
572318743.reviewBody:
We wanted to see crocodiles - El Cora is a good place to do it.
It is not a show/entertainment park, it is rather educational experience. The guides provide a lot of information, every question will be answered. 
There is a possiblity to keep a baby crocodile in hands, and also to touch a big crocodile :-) 

This place is littly difficult to find, best way to get there is local taxi.

My recomendation - yes, go there!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

570527632.name: awesome addition to our trip
570527632.author: a TripAdvisor user
570527632.reviewBody:
We visited here with our two children, ages 10 and 13.  
LONG dirt road in, not an issue with our cabbie, and he stayed and waited for us. 
we were in and out in 1.25 hour.  
Cost 200 pesos an adult and 100 pesos for child.  We paid about 600 pesos for the cab in and out, which included our driver waiting (from north end of Nuevo)
we were the  only people on the tour and had a vet as well as a biologist tour us, so we had ample opportunity to ask all our questions.  
This is more of a learning place than a thrill seeking place to see crocs...but that was what we were looking for.  It is quiet and serene and the staff seem like they are genuinely there to help the animals.  

great place to visit if you want something different and a learning experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

570291823.name: Very Interesting once you get there.
570291823.author: a TripAdvisor user
570291823.reviewBody: We took my 17 YO granddaughter to the Cocodrilos sanctuary last week.  The location is at the end of a very long very rough road.  We had not rented a car so we took a cab and seeing how hard a place it was to get to we had him wait for us.  (Cabs and waiting are all very reasonable in this area.)  The tour starts with touching a large croc\'s tail, very carefully with the guide between you and the croc.  Our guide was very low key and helpful and very respectful of the animals.  We saw quite a few crocs and the bonus was other animals, a peccary, goats, turtles, and our favorite, a coati.  The tour was instructive and interactive and reasonable priced, even including the taxi.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

568422745.name: Good info
568422745.author: a TripAdvisor user
568422745.reviewBody: In depth understanding of crocks and other wildlife. Guide was awesome. Interesting place off the beaten track\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

565336076.name: Great experience
565336076.author: a TripAdvisor user
565336076.reviewBody: It was our first time getting that close and personal with crocodiles. We got to hold baby crocodiles and touch fully grown ones with proper guidance. The sanctuary is a must see and for all nature lovers and budding  environmentalists. The tour guide was done by a biologist who was very passionate about conserving the swampland and natural habitat of the many species that call the area home. A budget friendly guaranteed hit with the kids.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

564963970.name: The reptile fan in our family got to realize  his dream.
564963970.author: a TripAdvisor user
564963970.reviewBody: El Cora is a great place to visit if you or your kids have an interest in seeing and or touching a live crocodile. The park is quite the ways off the main road down a dusty track so recommend taking a taxi and paying the driver to wait the hour for you. Trust me it\u2019s worth your time. It would take an hour easy to walk to the highway and probably a good 45 mins for a cab to come pick you up. The cab ride + driver waiting was $550 pesos all in. Entrance to the park is $200 pesos/person. Our guide Reuben was extremely knowledgeable and friendly and went out of his way to prepare my kids for their croc experience. My 12 year old daughter was a little bored with the intro however my 8 year old son was all in. The Sanctuary is in need of some love however your money is much needed and for the experience, it\u2019s worth it. Caring for and raising critters that eat while you sleep takes a lot of money and dedication and these folks are committed to the welfare of the animals. If you are interested in animals/ reptiles , (crocs, 9\u201d-10\u2019, goats, wild pigs, toucans, wild crocs in mangrove swamps and a fun adventure, spend the money, take snacks and water and enjoy. Plan on 2.5 hours total from Bucerias return.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

564934909.name: Great nature place
564934909.author: a TripAdvisor user
564934909.reviewBody: The sanctuary was very nice and the guide was very well educated and interactive. I would allow about 2 hours to be able to see and enjoy the visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

563546509.name: Totally Worth the Trip
563546509.author: a TripAdvisor user
563546509.reviewBody: First of all, I see someone posted that they thought the Guide was "intoxicated". I would dispute this, and say that he spoke quite slowly, and was trying very hard to make himself understood in English. My husband and I speak Spanish, and when we spoke to him in his native language, he answered very clearly and didn\'t pause one bit.  Ruben was his name.  He was SO good with all the animals, very soft spoken and kind and he gave us a one hour tour, that we all thought was excellent.  He did everything from letting us hold a baby croc, to having one of the adult crocs issue a "dont come any nearer" warning. We were also able to get up close to an adult male who is in captivity, because he is blind.  That means we were able to get right up to him and touch him.  I think this is a worthwhile cause to support.  The cost was 200 pesos for a one hour tour, and I don\'t think this is too much at all.  I\'m sure the guides are volunteers, and probably survive on their tips.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

563545363.name: Worth a visit
563545363.author: a TripAdvisor user
563545363.reviewBody: We visited the sanctuary yesterday, February 28, 2018.  We really enjoyed our visit and the guide, Rubin.  Thanks for an entertaining and informative visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

563247904.name: Cool and educational place to visit
563247904.author: a TripAdvisor user
563247904.reviewBody: Came here while we were on vacation at the Samba resort. We happened to go the day they were closed. The website did not say that. The price also changed. But we got in for the old price and the lady looking after the place took us on the tour anyway. They were just in the transition of updating their website. Pretty cool place. Kind of a run down though. Old structures and the like. But also in the process of upgrading it as well. Very educational and interesting to see live crocodiles. Even allowed us to touch one.  They even have have baby ones.  I would recommend going to see this place. One tip though. The road to get there is very bad. Most taxis won\u2019t want to take you there. But if they do, they charge a lot extra.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

552290971.name: Fun, educational and Exciting
552290971.author: a TripAdvisor user
552290971.reviewBody: We visited the Crocodile Sanctuary with our two sons age 10 and 8. It exceeded our expectations by a mile. The lady that gave us the tour there spoke flawless English, she is new to the sanctuary from France, gave us lots of information and answered all of our questions. The most exciting part is we all got to touch an adult crocodile and hold baby crocodiles. It was fun for the whole family!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

547401522.name: Not a MUST see attraction.... only if you have extra time
547401522.author: a TripAdvisor user
547401522.reviewBody: Must have your own vehicle or take a taxi as it is about a 2 mile walk off 200.  It\'s a bumpy one lane road, a little exciting...Once we got there we were greeted by what appeared to be an intoxicated guide.  He kept telling us the same things over and over before we even got started on the "tour".  We finally told him with our three year old we want to keep it moving which he then complied.  There was a few caged crocodiles and little crocs to hold.  This is located on a river way and we were there at high tide so didn\'t see any crocs in their natural setting.  We were told when the water was low, we would be able to see them.  They also had a parrot, turtles and a couple other animals in cages to see.  The guide did throw some raw chicken into the pond and the croc came towards it and ate it.  This was impressive..There were also some other SMALL displays of eggs, small crocs...I saw on trip advisor that someone noted there was a river safari from the sanctuary.  We did not see this.  So maybe we were there in the off season (Dec 2017) or it doesn\'t exist anymore.  Anyway I thought it was too much $$ for what we saw...and of course the guide wanted a tip at the end.  The restaurant also wasn\'t open when we were there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

546080690.name: If you love nature you must go here!
546080690.author: a TripAdvisor user
546080690.reviewBody:
It was a bumpy ride down a dirt road through the jungle and extra cab fare because they would have to wash the cab but worth every penny. We were warmly greeted by our host who explained respect for animals and there need for space 
Our host was a biologist and showed his love for the animals. 
We wish the sanctuary much success in teaching the public that animals can co-exist with us if we both respect their needs 
Thanks for a wonderful experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

544646978.name: Hidden Gem
544646978.author: a TripAdvisor user
544646978.reviewBody: We took our kids, 10/8/2. Great experience. Road is rough and it is a little run down, but it is safe and educational. The kids loved it! Good value.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

541853089.name: This place is so great!
541853089.author: a TripAdvisor user
541853089.reviewBody: I had a blast, this place is amazing! Hard to find if you don\'t know what you\'re looking for--going E on 200 it\'s a tiny path right off the highway just past the last exit for flamingos golf club. The staff is very knowledgeable and passionate about the local wildlife. If you go at low tide there are beautiful yellow spotted crabs EVERYWHERE!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

537759209.name: A Hidden Gem!
537759209.author: a TripAdvisor user
537759209.reviewBody: Found out about the El Cora online and decided to check it out same day. When we got there they had closed 30min early to attend to the habitats but after speaking with a worker at the gate they let us in. Not only did they let us in but we were given a complete 45min tour with no rush and we had an amazing experience! We learned lots and had a fantastic time, they really care for the animals and have great passion + dedication.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

535793079.name: Wonderful place and very informative
535793079.author: a TripAdvisor user
535793079.reviewBody: We had a bit of a hard time getting into the facility due to heavy rains and the road was flooded, but once we got there it was a great experience.  The guide was very knowledgeable and genuinely cares about his work and the crocodiles.  We learned a lot and truly enjoyed getting to see everything there.  Highly recommend this place if you are interested in seeing some crocodiles in person.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

520812073.name: Entertaining way to spend the afternoon with the family
520812073.author: a TripAdvisor user
520812073.reviewBody: We were there due to being on an HGTV Mexico Life coming up in October. It was one of their excursions for footage. I found it to be interesting and educational for everyone in the family. We had fun together and we got to hold to hold interesting little creatures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

506808893.name: Crocodile sanctuary
506808893.author: a TripAdvisor user
506808893.reviewBody: Great place set in the heart of a lagoon.  Excellent learning experience. Got to see many of the local fauna and the biologist who cares for them, Ruben, clearly works from the heart in all he does at keeping them safe and educating the public about so many misunderstood species.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

502333471.name: Such a FUN and educational experience for the WHOLE family!!!
502333471.author: a TripAdvisor user
502333471.reviewBody: Today we went to El Cora. The drive in is definitely better for an suv/truck as the road is a bit muddy and tricky in spots, but don\'t let that deter you! \nOnce there we were greeted by Ricardo who was more than gracious throughout our whole tour. It\'s considered an interactive tour so we were literally in with the crocodiles- touching them, learning about their stories, etc. It was such a cool experience and we have high hopes for what the future holds for the Sanctuary. \nNow that we\'re living in the area, we\'ll be visiting on a regular basis. You will not be disappointed!!!! Wear your sunscreen and bug repellent. You\'ll get your fill of touching and feeling the different animals and reptiles so hand sanitizer might be good too. Go support this fantastic group of dedicated individuals....Enjoy!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

501622251.name: Interactive Experience
501622251.author: a TripAdvisor user
501622251.reviewBody: This was an amazing experience! The passion that Rub\u00e9n has for the sanctuary and all of the animals in it is very inspiring. The tour was very interactive and personal. We even got to hold a baby crocodile! Definitely and experience that I would recommend to anyone in Bucerias wishing to learn a little bit about the wildlife in their surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

500982941.name: What an amazing experience!
500982941.author: a TripAdvisor user
500982941.reviewBody: I absolutely LOVED my visit to El Cora! I didn\'t know what to expect going in, and was even a little bit nervous, but the owner, Rub\u00e9n, made me feel very comfortable. I learned a lot not only about crocodiles, but also about mangroves and other wildlife. I got to touch a crocodile, and even held a baby croc! It\'s clear that the owner has a passion for working with animals, and wants to educate people about them. It only cost 200 pesos for a tour, which was an experience of a lifetime! If you\'re visiting the Bucerias/Puerto Vallarta area, or really anywhere in the Riviera Nayarit, you\'ve GOT to check it out!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

500838866.name: Incredible and unique experience
500838866.author: a TripAdvisor user
500838866.reviewBody: Ruben is a brilliant and kind-hearted man. He knows so much about animals and makes you fall in love with them. Anyone visiting the Bucerias/Vallerta area should explore this sanctuary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

483439602.name: Up Close and Personal
483439602.author: a TripAdvisor user
483439602.reviewBody:
I came to the Santuario with a film crew hoping to shoot some close interaction between us and the animals.  We were NOT disappointed.  Ruben, the biologist who runs the place, is a certified animal whisperer.  We were able to pet full sized crocs and hold the babies.  Plus, there are a bunch of other cool animals there that are very tame.  Ruben was even able to call a wild croc to dock over a small stream.  We were skeptical but then BOOM there he was!!

The best part about the Santuario is that Ruben and his staff truly love the animals.  I was concerned that, like many other animal attractions in Mexico, that the animals may not be well treated.  This is NOT the case at El Cora.  Ruben is very passionate about conservation and teaching visitors that crocodiles are not aggressive or dangerous to people.  His life's mission to promote greater understanding of these majestic creatures.

Overall, my whole crew loved the experience and our FB and Instagram accounts are now full of crocodiles!!  Muchisimas Gracias Ruben!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

481513648.name: Crocodile sanctuary
481513648.author: a TripAdvisor user
481513648.reviewBody: Little gem of a find, fun day getting up close to crocodiles and even touching them, the guide was very knowledgeable and kept us all engrossed. Lots of birds to spot, and a few rescued animals. Not an expensive day but unforgettable

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

473716434.name: If you like nature, you will love this place
473716434.author: a TripAdvisor user
473716434.reviewBody:
The place is far away from everything, so make sure you either have a 4WD car or hire a big enough cab to drive you there. 

Also, some reviews state there is a MX$20 donation to enter. That is not the case. Things have changed and now they do a MX$200/person tour. Be aware before you travel there.

Ricardo was our guide. The guy oozes excitement for nature. He showed us all the animals in the place. The best part was to hear him call Matias, a wild crocodile, from a pontoon in the river next to the place. I did not think Matias would show up. To my surprise he did. On cue. And he was a big boy. I think this was the I liked the most of my trip to PV.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

463567758.name: Excellent place to visit right in middle of Nuevo Vallarta
463567758.author: a TripAdvisor user
463567758.reviewBody: This place seems to be unknown yet it is in the middle of Nuevo Vallarta.  Ricardo was an excellent guide and has a personal connection to the animals.  Getting to hold and touch some of them was an amazing experience.  It is small but very interactive and educational at the same time.  We loved it and would highly recommend visiting.  When we visited there was no set cost just a recommended donation.  The road from the highway in is pretty rough and bumpy but not that long.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

455225217.name: Learned a lot
455225217.author: a TripAdvisor user
455225217.reviewBody: Went there expecting to see a few crocodiles and have some lunch as we were told you could eat there. The sanctuary was is in the midst of changing ownerships. When we went there was no restaurant but they took around and showed us baby crocodiles, teenagers and older ones. The also had a bit of zoo so we got to see some other animals. While it wasn\'t what we were expecting we learned a lot and it was quite interesting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

454830639.name: Dirt Road 30 minutes drive
454830639.author: a TripAdvisor user
454830639.reviewBody:
Make sure have 4WD to get there. Mon-Wednesday is close. Call before go. We went there without checking if they are open, end up nothing is open. 

Make sure have 4WD to get there. Mon-Wednesday is close. Call before go. We went there without checking if they are open, end up nothing is open.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

451064318.name: Great Guided Tour from Wonderful Guide
451064318.author: a TripAdvisor user
451064318.reviewBody: We visited the sanctuary about three years ago and it has been taken over by a new group from this man who was trying to rescue the reptiles and there is a wonderful improvement in the facilities  Several crocs, some wild-ish pigs, goats, parrots.  Our 8 and 10 year old grandchildren were impressed as they got to hold a baby croc and my husband was impressed with the dedication and knowledge or our biologist guide. However, we did the tour in Spanish -- not sure about doing it in English.\nPlace has a ways to go and the road is an adventure in itself, but if you are in the area -- especially with children-- well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

446301613.name: See the big crocs with the people that know them
446301613.author: a TripAdvisor user
446301613.reviewBody:
We took a cab from Bucerias to the Croc Sanctuary - it's a really rough road but cars, vans and trucks were on it.  Cost of the cab round trip was 600 peso.  This is the sanctuary near the Flamingo Resort.

This is a working sanctuary and you can tell the people running it really love the crocs.  Our guide had pretty good English so was able to communicate fairly well with us and answer questions.  There are a number of other local animals in rehab at the sanctuary.

We touched a four foot croc, watched them feed a 9 footer and held a baby croc for pics.  All done with a lot of respect for the crocs - no leaping crocs jumping out of the water for food.

This is not a glitzy commercial type operation - I think the tours are offered mainly for public education and fund raising.  It's going to appeal to people that want to get close to the crocs in a rustic setting.  Took about 1 1/2 hours plus travel.  Donation was 200 peso for each person.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

442835344.name: Crocs and Margaritas
442835344.author: a TripAdvisor user
442835344.reviewBody: They have some big crocs you can get good pictures from a distance that you recognize what you are looking at. The margaritas are big and taste like there is tequila in the drink not like most others in many touristy bars.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

434084177.name: Really Interesting with More than Just Crocodiles
434084177.author: a TripAdvisor user
434084177.reviewBody: My dad found this place on TripAdvisor while we were staying in Puerto Vallarta. Our hotel rep hadn\'t been before mainly due to the rough road to get there. Once you do, however, you enjoy a private tour of the sanctuary during which you get up close and personal with many animals and learn about the philosophy of the organisation. I strongly recommend this for its individual ideas. It gives great stories to later tell your friends!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

431897617.name: Hidden Gem that needs to shine again!
431897617.author: a TripAdvisor user
431897617.reviewBody: I\'ve gone here every time I\'ve been to mexico.  The first time was shortly before the tour buses stopped doing tours there and i had an amazing time with great food.  My second time there a few years later was still just as amazing.  While there isn\'t much to see, there is much to experience.  They also have a really good restaurant that I would highly recommend trying out.  We were very fortunate enough to have seen a crocodile, which had been wandering around a golf course, that was captured and released into the sanctuary.  Watching the local firefighters handle it like the pros they are was definitely an experience!  \n\nWhile the last time we were there we were told the tour buses no longer do regular tours there -I hope that changes and this place gets back to how it should be! Regardless it\'s still a gem of an experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

393643029.name: Interesting & educational
393643029.author: a TripAdvisor user
393643029.reviewBody: The people are very passionate about caring for the animals. It was enjoyable & very educational. They did every thing to help me understand what they were doing as well as let this old guy hold a baby crock.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

390719391.name: Very interesting
390719391.author: a TripAdvisor user
390719391.reviewBody: After reading others reviews about this attraction I decided I must go for myself. I asked my local host family about it and although they have lived her for 30 years, they had never been, so we all went together.(1/2 price for locals) (senior, 4 yr old, 14 yr old, 2 adults) Thank goodness they have a truck - the 3 km.ride from the main road to the attraction is extremely bumpy and filled with pot holes and mud holes! Bring bug spray! You can buy it there but you probably already have it. Ruben, the guide, is extremely knowledgeable and compassionate about all the animals and is happy to practice English. I recommend it to all.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

381615828.name: Rather interesting
381615828.author: a TripAdvisor user
