381615828.reviewBody: We drove to the attraction in our rental car,should have had an suv.\nEverything is very primitive,the guy/owner speaks very poor english.However he has very likeable quality.Looks like the has a real passion almost obsession. \nThe whole experience was sort of goofy ,just the same it was fun .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

380627841.name: Knowledgable and friendly guide
380627841.author: a TripAdvisor user
380627841.reviewBody: The road to the sanctuary would be better in a 4x4 although we did make it in a taxi.  Arrange for your taxi driver to wait.  Ours did and was also entertaining both ways.  It is worth a visit to see the crocodiles and other animals.  Entertaining and informative.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

373220903.name: Best day in Mexico EVER
373220903.author: a TripAdvisor user
373220903.reviewBody:
I've been to Mexico 6 times, Mayan side and now Puerto Vallarta side.
This was by far the most memorable day I've had travelling ...ever!!!!!!!
This crocodile sanctuary is ran by educated, humble, intelligent, animal lovers. It isn't a "captivity" scenario like the zoos (where the animals are highly drugged and malnourished so they can be held and played with in captivity) , it's built in the middle of a huge swampland it's open to public yet locals and most tourists have never heard of it!!!! We asked several reception people at Riu Jalisco where we stayed and they were unsure eventually they found an employee who knew what we were talking about.
Our cab driver "Torres" drove us in (10 minutes from our hotel) and we adventured into the foresty area a few kilometres of hilly rocky gravel into a little sanctuary. 
It opened at 11:30 despite the signage saying 11 am, we were scorching hot dying of heat but our cab driver got out and waited with us, so we invited him to come on the tour and we paid his way (150 pesos per person, about 10$ Canadian each.)
Very cheap and WELL worth the visit.
Our other tour will cost us 300+ dollars Canadian for a night out at rhythm of the night (stay tuned for review!) 
So we walked through its about an hour and a half long,
Held crocs, learned about their behaviours and the statistics around their lifespans, they have two blind crocs saved and kept in their habitats to stay healthy, most of the crocs brought there are ones reported at hotels and beaches and local neighbourhoods. They are delicately captured (he explained how it's traditionally done vs how they catch them, they monitor them and help feed and heal them if they're sick or injured, they're marked and then released into a swap to live freely.
We saw turtles (pets- not captured) and a few other injured animals being conditioned to go back into the wild, the tour guide was incredibly passionate about getting the animals back to their non captive homes because he has studied the ecosystems and is highly conscious of the balance. He left his family to study and care for the animals in the sanctuary it was super cool to see him train the younger staff how to hold the animals and explain how to wash and care for them.
Anyways, long story short...Go!!!!!!
Well worth the drive and money and experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

359574700.name: Off the beaten path experience
359574700.author: a TripAdvisor user
359574700.reviewBody: What it lacks in facility the tour guides make up in passion and experience! The 3 km bumpy dirt road added to the exciting experience. Very happy we ventured out there with our 3 young boys!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

355646637.name: Surprise your guest.
355646637.author: a TripAdvisor user
355646637.reviewBody: For a out of ordinary excursion. The 2km. Road is an experience by itself. The premises have been modify from a jungle restaurant to a crocodile preservation haven.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

349023293.name: Local, Scientific, Hands on, Welcoming, Authentic Natural Setting - Glad we went!
349023293.author: a TripAdvisor user
349023293.reviewBody: This was a great experience!!  We got our own private tour (as there was no one else currently visiting the sanctuary).  The tour guide was very informative and passionate about the crocodiles.  Not only did we see crocs that were part of the sanctuary, but also a couple other crocs sunning on the side of the the nearby lagoon.  There were also a few other species that were part of the sanctuary.  We got to go into the pen that housed a big croc, plus we got to hold two different sizes of crocodiles. \n\nWe were staying at Paradise Village in Nuevo Vallarta, and the taxi cost was 200 pesos one way, and he offered to stay while we did the tour for an extra 100 pesos.  With the long dirt drive from the highway (as mentioned in some other reviews), we thought it was worth to us. The tour itself cost 150 pesos per person. The tour was about 1 1/2 hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

345609217.name: El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary \u2013 A treat for nature lovers.
345609217.author: a TripAdvisor user
345609217.reviewBody:
If you are a nature lover and are visiting the Puerto Vallarta (PV) region be sure to make the effort to visit the El Cora Crocodile Sanctuary just west of the town of Mezcales, only about 6 km north of the PV airport. The entrance to the refuge is just south of the Flamingos Golf Course, you’ll see the large golf ball on a tee; the small sign indicating the road to the refuge is just south of that. There is a winding, bumpy, occasionally submerged (in the wet season) dirt road that leads in to the refuge about 2 km from the main road. We took a taxi from the Royal Decameron resort in Bucerias to the refuge for 200 Pesos. The driver had been there before, but didn’t appear too happy about making the journey. However, for another 200 Pesos for the return trip he was willing to come back and pick us up after a couple of hours. One note: the refuge doesn’t open until 11:00, we had gotten there too early and had to kill some time bird-watching , which was actually a bonus as the wetlands around the refuge site are loaded with birds. We were later told that it’s best to time your visit with low tide as the mud flats that become exposed are a magnet for birds of all sorts.

It costs 200 Pesos per person to enter the refuge, but it is well worth it. You will get a close-up experience with the American Crocodiles (Crocodylus acutus) and other local wildlife. The staff there are genuinely concerned with helping the local crocodiles and preserving the region’s biodiversity in general. The refuge and the surrounding estuarine wetlands are a hidden jewel in an otherwise human-dominated landscape.

Though we did not stay for lunch, there is a restaurant on site that apparently has excellent seafood. We were happy to pay our admission and left a generous donation, too, to help with the refuge’s important conservation efforts.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

345466338.name: Crocodile tour
345466338.author: a TripAdvisor user
345466338.reviewBody: This is a must if you have kids and a couple of hours between travel and the tour.  New custodians are working on improving the facilities, but offer a tour that takes about an hour and walks you through the ecology of the crocodiles and the environment they live in.  There are a few other local animals they care for as well.  If nothing else you may get to touch a live (but sufficiently small) crocodile and contribute to on-going sanctuary efforts.... several of their animals came in blind and will never be in a state to be released.  Wheel chair accessible if you know how to work a stair or two.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

345068204.name: Good work, good time
345068204.author: a TripAdvisor user
345068204.reviewBody: The crocodile sanctuary manages a lagoon preserve where a hundred+ crocs thrive, and sick ones are tended. The tours, led by the animal experts who do the actual work, are informative and fun. Saw crocs of all ages, plus turtles, parrots, a peccary, etc. The lagoon, reached by a stable if shaky wooden pier, is the beautiful home as well to cranes and who knows what other birds. Peaceful feeling pervades, even as the giant beasts lurk. And some are VERY large. Those, you just watch move ... but, hey, where else can you hold and pet a baby crocodile? Rumored good food was in sight. Only warning ... make sure you have a firm contract with your cabbie, as he will have to wait for you (our nice guy also took the tour with us) since the sanctuary is well off the beaten path, reachable only by a very bumpy and narrow dirt road.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

334717343.name: Great Visit to the Sanctuary with the family
334717343.author: a TripAdvisor user
334717343.reviewBody: We spent about 2 hours at the Sanctuary looking at the various animals and of course the crocodiles.  The staff was very knowledgeable of the sanctuary and he went out of his way to answer our questions.  He let the kids hold a 16 year old Croc and we were accompanied by the 2 resident K9s as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

306378434.name: The boxer
306378434.author: a TripAdvisor user
306378434.reviewBody: Excellent.  Great educational surroundings for children of all ages. Staff very knowledgeable and the small detailed tour is incredible. Nice restaurant located on the grounds for good food and beverages. A must see for families with children. John

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

292118358.name: An off road adventure!
292118358.author: a TripAdvisor user
292118358.reviewBody: Don\'t go unless your vehicle is a 4x4. the road in is very bad and muddy. I lost my front bumper going in only to find it was not open. We had been there before when the road was not as bad. It is interesting!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

252158772.name: Interesting
252158772.author: a TripAdvisor user
252158772.reviewBody: Even though the road into the farm was unbelievably bad our cabi handled it like a pro, a few belly rubs here & there.  We had no idea what was at the end. It was very unique & nothing I had ever seen before..holding those baby crocs was very cool..we plan on going back this month with our daughter...you would never see anything like this back in Canada

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

243193859.name: Not something you see every day!
243193859.author: a TripAdvisor user
243193859.reviewBody: As others have noted, it\'s a long road thru the "jungle" to get there but it\'s a great experience.   I took my daughter\'s family there earlier this year and they really loved it.   We lucked out by having a great volunteer who walked us through the area, introducing us and telling us history of each crocodile and ending with each of the 3 boys (ages 16-11) getting to hold a baby crocodile and have their picture taken.   Of course, I added a little bit extra to the donations jar but when I tried to give the volunteer a propina (tip), he put that in the donations jar as well.   Every one of us enjoyed it!

227283514.name: It\'s different!
227283514.author: a TripAdvisor user
227283514.reviewBody: Very long road in, yup crocs were sleepy, buy amazed decent patio dining and food was very good. Fun experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

182580226.name: Long Road to Sleepy Crocs
182580226.author: a TripAdvisor user
182580226.reviewBody:
This crocodile sanctuary is located off of Mexico 200 Highway (also called Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic) just south of the Flamingos Golf Course.  Heading south from Bucerias there is a large golf ball indicating the entrance to the golf course.  A very little bit father is a small entrance marked by a small sign indicating the small entrance to the Santuario de Cocodrilos.  This is an unpaved, one lane country road that takes you the three kilometers to the sanctuary.  The bad news is that as of October 26, 2013, the road has at least four serious potholes that were a challenge to our VW Jetta.  The good news is that, according to the manager of the sanctuary, the road will be smoothed out in two weeks.

The sanctuary has several ponds in which crocodiles hide.  The manager is very helpful in spotting the crocs and in encouraging them to come to the surface.  Several of the crocs are very large and all of them are scary.  There is a small exhibit of two very small, very active baby crocs.  The sanctuary has other animals as well including geese, which are very loud and poop on the walkways: not good.  There are a number of large turtles as well.  There is one lone coati mundi, Mexican raccoon, in a small cage: this is not good for that animal.

It only takes an hour ot see the sanctuary.  This one is not as large as the one in San Blas, but it is a lot closer to Bucerias.  The fee is 15 pesos per person, but a larger donation is appreciated.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Puerto Vallarta-Tepic s/n Laguna El Quelele

673492356.name: Beautiful old church
673492356.author: a TripAdvisor user
673492356.reviewBody: This is a beautiful example of the old Mexican architecture. Ti\'s definitely worth a quick stop. We were just walking around Bucerias and happened upon it. Walked right inside before they were closing for the evening.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia Nuestra Senora de la Paz

657087633.name: Contrasts
657087633.author: a TripAdvisor user
657087633.reviewBody: Beautiful old church with old lines,iron work grills and quiet plaza in front of it.  Inside is a more modern minimalistic design.  Quiet but only steps away from the Malecon and the mercado.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia Nuestra Senora de la Paz

655855696.name: Beautiful
655855696.author: a TripAdvisor user

652571912.name: Peace and tranquility await you, just across the street from centro.
652571912.author: a TripAdvisor user
652571912.reviewBody: Take a break from the market vendors and sun. Step into the courtyard surrounding this church and you will instantly calm and enjoy the serenity amidst all the busy streets.  There are benches throughout this garden.  Beautiful stained glass inside as well as seating for self reflection.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia Nuestra Senora de la Paz

635228117.name: Great old Church
635228117.author: a TripAdvisor user
635228117.reviewBody: Wonder full old world church, what a peaceful little spot to spend some time exploring around. Well worth a visit

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia Nuestra Senora de la Paz

572953327.name: Peaceful with a simple beauty
572953327.author: a TripAdvisor user
572953327.reviewBody:
Monday morning the 11th April and we visited the small town of Bucerias, which was about 1 hours walk from our hotel, Riu Palace Pacifico. The Church is one of the highlights of the town and is situated downtown near the town square and El Buzo de Bucerias, the statue of the diver.

The Church is also know as Senora de la Paz (Lady of Peace).

There is nothing lavish or overly ornate about this Church but that is part of its charm and adds to the serenity of the place. The altar has a large statue of Jesus's Christ with a striking painted backdrop behind it.

The main part of the Church is furnished with simple wooden pews and kneeling benches.

The Church is open during the day and visitors are welcome as long as they dress appropriately and remove caps/hats and sunglasses.

It was delightful to sit in this holy place, take some time out from the world outside and appreciate the serenity inside this lovely Church. 

Recall seeing a notice to inform that there were 2 Services held here on Sunday mornings, think it was about 08.00am and 10.00am (would check these times)

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia Nuestra Senora de la Paz

651604599.name: There is always a workshop being offering
651604599.author: a TripAdvisor user
651604599.reviewBody: I visit this art shop/gallery every year. Usually she has a workshop going on or about to begin. It is an interesting medium to use. I feel her workshops are very good,I have seen the results over the years and they are impressive.

649953145.name: Breathtaking backsplashes & well stocked
649953145.author: a TripAdvisor user
649953145.reviewBody: This little store is a gem. Full of art to purchase and supplies for creators. We will definetly return as we finish decorating our home in Punta Mita.

646485497.name: Tiles & More
646485497.author: a TripAdvisor user
646485497.reviewBody: There are several artisans in this courtyard area, each with some original works and opportunity to take classes.  First stop during Thursday Art Walk and then returned 1-2 more times.  \nWorth a visit.

552017423.name: Amazing Work Christy!
552017423.author: a TripAdvisor user
552017423.reviewBody: We met Christy on our visit to Bucerias and were so impressed with her work.  We ordered a mirror for our home - it is absolutely beautiful and we enjoyed the process.  Be sure to stop by to see her mosaics, small, medium and large.  Lots of art around, paintings and other treasures.  A find for sure.

477484605.name: Fun place to walk around
477484605.author: a TripAdvisor user
477484605.reviewBody: Have visited this place often and it never disappoints for a leasure walk around beautiful art work.

463857342.name: Art
463857342.author: a TripAdvisor user
463857342.reviewBody: The art shown here is from local artist. It amazed me at what can be made with vision. I truly enjoyed looking at the art work.

365868255.name: Take some time to create a memorable experiance
365868255.author: a TripAdvisor user
365868255.reviewBody: If you are artistic, or not, you need to take a class at A Broken Art, create something beautiful that will forever remind you of the best vacation you ever had, in Bucerias. You will be instructed by the most talented artist in her field, the project you complete will be a topic of discussion for years to come.

348609347.name: Nice Art
348609347.author: a TripAdvisor user
348609347.reviewBody: We did a quick walk through, nice pieces of different types of art. Friendly people, we\'re not that big on purchasing these items. But nice to look at.

347222642.name: Beautiful work
347222642.author: a TripAdvisor user
347222642.reviewBody: Christie turns out beautiful things. One of her mosaics graces our home in Bucerias. She will work with you to get you what you want. Highly recommended !

345942054.name: Go just to meet Christie
345942054.author: a TripAdvisor user
345942054.reviewBody: Christie is an amazing artist and if you\'re lucky you\'ll see her working on a new project.  She creates works of art from broken glass and tiles mostly by commission but she has some great stuff available for sale sometimes too.  Her place has the look and feel of an artist\'s studio with many works in progress and her tools and broken tiles strewn here and there.  Christie has a great personality... she\'ll tell you exactly how she feels!  Drop in if you\'re in the area.

339710409.name: Classes, shopping and viewing all in one stop. Make your own memory of Bucerias
339710409.author: a TripAdvisor user
339710409.reviewBody: The owner and artist offers afternoon classes where you can make and take your own mosaic piece.  If you aren\'t a mker, there is an abundance of beautiful art to see and buy.

264448243.name: Finally saw "Miss Bessy and her Mark Twain"
264448243.author: a TripAdvisor user
264448243.reviewBody: I\'ve taken a couple of classes from Chrissie but hadn\'t seen her perform.   I expected a good show but I saw a GREAT show.  She expertly plays all parts in a one-person historical play.   It was really riveting and entertaining.   I can\'t wait til the next one!

160134159.name: Fun - Fabulous
160134159.author: a TripAdvisor user
160134159.reviewBody: A must must see when in Bucerias and take a workshop! I Loved the workshops I took (mosaic and jewelry)..  Christy\'s high energy, positive out look and love for life, just jumps at you when you walk into her studio.  You just smile!  She is eager to share her talent and skills.  And she is talented!.  She has the most amazing puppy that greets you.  Christy I will be back next year January and look forward to another workshop!  \nCarmel,\nGabriola Island, B.C.

144425246.name: What fun!
144425246.author: a TripAdvisor user
144425246.reviewBody: I had family visiting and I thought  we could do a craft class that would help her have a souvenir she would love.....we took a class with Christy and made beautiful tiled frames. Christy was warm, funny and easy to follow. She helped us make beautiful pieces we will both treasure. Her shop is relaxed and full of interesting things. You can admire, buy or make things or just have a chat with a funny local. Stop in at Art Walk.....

116400890.name: Unique and fun
116400890.author: a TripAdvisor user
116400890.reviewBody:
You will find excellent pieces of art here that are one of a kind.  Great to just walk around and see what they have.  They tell us they will also do custom work for you.  We have not purchased anything yet, but like to go and browse hoping we will find the perfect piece of art for our tastes and budget.

Grab a coffee next door and enjoy.

Brad & Joey

38888523.name: A Broken Art
38888523.author: a TripAdvisor user
38888523.reviewBody: Great art studio owned by Kristy who so talented. She has amazing glass mosaic tiles that she makes herself and then creates beautiful items. She makes custom pieces and also offers classes during the high season. She is located next to Sweet Things and close to Mark\'s restaurant. I was looking for a canvas painting and she took time out of her day to drive us to a gallery five miles from her studio. She then had them disassemble the painting from it\'s frame and had it delivered to her studio where she packaged it for me for the plane. Kristy\'s an awesome lady. Please visit her when you\'re in Bucerias and say "hello" to Hola.

673656709.name: Selfie Heaven
673656709.author: a TripAdvisor user
673656709.reviewBody: The Buzo Sculpture is the number one photo op in Bucerias. Absolutely everyone wants their photo taken in front of the Buzo.

657088251.name: Worth the stop
657088251.author: a TripAdvisor user
657088251.reviewBody: The statue of the divers is a nod to the oyster and pearl diving industries of the town. The statue is an interesting piece of engineering as well as art.  The diver is held up and in place on a slender pole that is his underwater spear.  Certainly worth the walk to it when in the central plaza

656024472.name: Bucerias
656024472.author: a TripAdvisor user
656024472.reviewBody: Spend a few hours in Bucerias as met up with friends who were staying at another resort. Had lunch on the beach and walked around the flea market. Enjoyed our time.

640551341.name: Bucerias Has The Flavor Of Old Mexico
640551341.author: a TripAdvisor user
640551341.reviewBody: We enjoyed our walking tour of Bucerias and felt it had more of the flavor of old Mexico than the touristy Puerto Vallarta area.  We walked the beach and had a drink in a small seaside grill, bought souvenir t-shirts in the tourist shops, had a big lunch in a beachfront restaurant, saw the "Diver of Bucerias," and the main square. It\'s a great little town.

640368927.name: Good ceviche, good service.
640368927.author: a TripAdvisor user
640368927.reviewBody: Stopped in for a quick bite early lunchtime.  We had fish ceviche and drinks.  Good service, good drinks and good ceviche.  Moderately priced.  Great view right on the beach.

635228944.name: Nice little Market
635228944.author: a TripAdvisor user
635228944.reviewBody: Nice little flea market to entertain yourself for a while. All the usually tee shirts, hats etc, worth a visit, but a lot of bargaining required to get a bargain.

623358447.name: Wirth the trip
623358447.author: a TripAdvisor user
623358447.reviewBody: Bargains are to be found at this area of wonderful restaurants, bars, coffee houses as well as a flee market.

614477069.name: Fun and good!
614477069.author: a TripAdvisor user
614477069.reviewBody: this is a querky place, with a fairly standard menu, a good bar, and fun atmosphere. And it really is in the middle of the town square.

612895073.name: nice day at the beach!
612895073.author: a TripAdvisor user
612895073.reviewBody: great beach to spend the day...  nice little market and convenience store close by...\nthere is also a few hotels or places you can stay around the area

586458512.name: An interesting day touring!
586458512.author: a TripAdvisor user
586458512.reviewBody: We had a great time going through the markets and sightseeing. We spent the afternoon at Fat Boys on the beach. Lots of entertainment and interesting venders walking by selling their wares. They would even go look for something for you if they didn\'t have it themselves. The food was great the biggest prawns I\'ve ever had. They tasted like lobster.

580671099.name: Casual and refreshing stop to eat on the Beach
580671099.author: a TripAdvisor user
580671099.reviewBody: Right on the beach, open but out of the sun so nice and cool.  We had the tuna ceviche, the shrimp ceviche and a hamburger and fries.  All quite good.  My marguerita was good but of course on a hot day the ice kept melting.  They were accommodating with ice refills in a bucket and the server was friendly and helpful.  The music was a little loud for my mothers taste, but not so bad that we had to ask them to turn it down.  Because it was right on the beach and open, we of course had beach vendors come over and try to sell us this and that...always a bit of a pain, but nobody was overly persistent so all went well. I would definitely stop off there for lunch on a hot day again!

572957196.name: Statue of a diver
572957196.author: a TripAdvisor user
572957196.reviewBody:
Monday morning the 11th April and we visited the small town of Bucerias. One of the attractions of the town is this statue of the diver

It is situated in downtown Bucerias by the seafront near one of the entrances to the Market, near the town square and across the road from the Church of Our Lady of Peace

Bucerias actually means the Place of Divers and the word Buzo means diver.

Nice statue nothing special, would not make a trip just to see it but worth a look if passing.

566113328.name: Entertaining
566113328.author: a TripAdvisor user
566113328.reviewBody: Across from the church is the town plaza.  Lots of food and shopping opportunities and the beach is in front of the plaza.  The best churros sold here in the evenings!  Events are often taken place here including music and dancing.  The Market stalls start here  and many other shops and restaurants on nearby streets.

564995411.name: Fun !
564995411.author: a TripAdvisor user
564995411.reviewBody: Tons of cool shops, friendly locals and places on the beach to eat & drink. Colors galore. Wear comfy walking shoes.

563763264.name: A pleasant place
563763264.author: a TripAdvisor user
563763264.reviewBody: We did the "tourist thing" for a few minutes.  You know, window shopping, picture along side the statue, being asked endlessly is we wanted a taxi, eating a light lunch at a local restaurant, searching through endless Chinese made items in the local mercado.  Just the tourist thing.  Not at all a bad way to pass a lovely, sunshiny afternoon.

558924474.name: Beachside Heaven
558924474.author: a TripAdvisor user
558924474.reviewBody: Stopped by El Brujo and enjoyed a great table on the beach. Fantastic view of the bay. Chips and salsa are provided at no charge, goes well with ice cold refreshments. We ordered as a light lunch the chicken nachos and they were delicious, the best I have ever had in PV. On Wednesday it is 2 for 1 ribs, so definetly try this place in Bucerias.

557618834.name: Nice walk
557618834.author: a TripAdvisor user
557618834.reviewBody: We walked along the beach from Riu Vallarta and looked quickly at the statue then walked around and stopped in a coffee shop, quite a lot to do and see in Bucerias, the beach can be hard work to walk along but it is worth it when you gey there, and you have the return walk to look forward to.

555240429.name: Meh...
555240429.author: a TripAdvisor user
555240429.reviewBody: I didn\'t like their original bar/location between Bucerias and La Cruz, but thought we\'d give the new Bucerias oceanfront location a try.  Very underwhelmed by the service, the drinks and the menu.  Won\'t be back.

553795498.name: Fabulous Area
553795498.author: a TripAdvisor user
553795498.reviewBody: I walked down the beach from the Riu J to Bucerias. It was great to have the sun at my back. It was a quick walk. When I got there a Farmers Market was on. I kept walking and there was a walk bridge, being my first time in the area I wasn\u2019t too sure what I would find on the other side. I crossed over and there were a lot more fronts sells their wares. There were also restaurants, OXXO shops, a beautiful church that was a must to see, a large grocery store and this is where the beautiful statue of the man opening the oyster. The pier here is lovely. I\u2019m glad I had the chance to check it out.

549988734.name: Dinner
549988734.author: a TripAdvisor user
549988734.reviewBody: First visit here after they moved to this location food and service want very good. Upon going back we were very disappointed with the food and noise from loud people dining by us. Service. Was good but that is it

489216451.name: Great Photo Op
489216451.author: a TripAdvisor user
489216451.reviewBody: El Buzo is a classic.  Absolute must photo stop!  Not truly wheel chair accessible, but still a good stop as it can be seen and appreciated from a distance. Plan on 10-15 minutes.

477579347.name: statue
477579347.author: a TripAdvisor user
477579347.reviewBody: must see and have a beer enjoy the people and music. scenery and all the shops to check out is a blast.

474967237.name: Market !!
474967237.author: a TripAdvisor user
474967237.reviewBody: Very good Market with lots of locals, with many local arts and crafts to buy. Have fun haggling for the best deal

473192500.name: Love the street vendors
473192500.author: a TripAdvisor user
473192500.reviewBody: You dont go wrong with any of the street tacos or churros.  Love going downtown bucerias.  Flea market shops and restaurants.

468980494.name: Amazing look at real Mexico
468980494.author: a TripAdvisor user
468980494.reviewBody:
When in Bucerias a trip to the town square is a must. There are countless vendors at the flea market eager to sell their wares. It's fun to barter with them while picking up some souvenirs. 
Also stopping in for lunch and a cool drink at one of the beachside restaurants is a great way to take a break from the heat. Not to mention the fresh seafood is fantastic. 
This is a small look at the behind the scenes look into the real people of Mexico. Take the opportunity to walk into the church and see the incredible architecture not only there but in many of the local buildings. 
Truely a place you don't want to miss only minutes from you resort and a short taxi ride from Peurto Vallarta.

432687188.name: Real Mexico
432687188.author: a TripAdvisor user
432687188.reviewBody: Visited many times during our stay a little glimpse of the real Mexico and people \nLots of bars and restaurants beware if you visit mid afternoon it\'s ridiculously hot good excuse for a few coronas at one of the beachside restaurants \nThe stall holders in the market are vying for your pesos so be prepared to be constantly asked to buy just good fun be polite and walk on .. great place to visit for a break from the beach

398858636.name: Fast, fun seafood
398858636.author: a TripAdvisor user
398858636.reviewBody: You have to try the "balazos" and/or the "bazucasos", tasty seafood shots, mainly oysters. It\'s extremely fresh, you can watch the fishermen coming off the beach with their bounty. It\'s also a fun place where local expats hang out and then when the music comes out it\'s a fun place for tequila.

380011316.name: Something for everyone
380011316.author: a TripAdvisor user
380011316.reviewBody:
We visited Bucerias Square on several occasions,
We loved the restaurants and beach.

We visited the flea market there - this is what you expect - everyone is trying to entice you in and can be a bit full on.

357691557.name: Locals bar
357691557.author: a TripAdvisor user
357691557.reviewBody: Typical locals bat, lots of beer, very good guacamole and friendly staff. They also have a very cool decal for your car and my only complaint is that they never have any in stock. They promise them daily but never deliver

353702850.name: Spectacular Piece Of Art
353702850.author: a TripAdvisor user
353702850.reviewBody:
This hand crafted piece of art depicts Bucerias and it's divers. You have not picked up the Bucerias vibe until you have viewed this land mark. If possible also take part in the yearly festival at Centro in December. It is to mark the anniversary of the Buzo.
The statue is at the ocean front area of Centro Bucerias. Make sure you have your picture taken here.
Hope to see you at the Buzo.
Dr.Rico
Canada

347764252.name: The walk to becerias is 15 minutes from the royal decamerom
347764252.author: a TripAdvisor user
347764252.reviewBody: We did take the local bus into puerto valarta for the day as it was over cast and not a great day for the beach.  The walk into buecerias is verytame and not a big deal. Lots of small shops and apartments on the way. Stopped on the way back for abucket of beer fot 6 on the way back and it was really good, hot day and cheap.

339977289.name: Great bar!
339977289.author: a TripAdvisor user
339977289.reviewBody: Well priced, terrific cocktails, beautiful outdoor atmosphere!  The food and service was also very good.  Try the ribs!

309246945.name: Ballazos!
309246945.author: a TripAdvisor user
309246945.reviewBody: This is a nice bar there drinks are awesome. If you want a little more excitement and are into the Mexican vibe this is an awesome place to go to!

266018100.name: Great Ocean Side Centro Statue.
266018100.author: a TripAdvisor user
266018100.reviewBody:
This pulls the Spirit of Bucerias together. The name Bucerias means Home of the Divers. Stop and have your picture taken here.it is a new landmark for Bucerias Centro.

Dr.Rico
Canada

261053843.name: loved the ribs
261053843.author: a TripAdvisor user
261053843.reviewBody: very pleasant atmosphere,  not bothered by smokers even though it is an outdoor/open air venue,  the two for one deal on ribs was a great buy and the quality was there.  Service was prompt and professional.  Would happily recommend this restaurant especially on ribs nite.

254191624.name: good idea for self organised  day out
254191624.author: a TripAdvisor user
254191624.reviewBody: lovely walk along beach  where you can spot pelicans and dolphins .Town very  quaint and on the day we went we saw a group of street artists dressed as Indians - singing and dancing in the main roadway . Fantastic market area between the beach and the plaza .Nice to sit at one of the beach restaurants /caf\u00e9 for a relaxing lunch and drink  and extremely cheap in comparison to UK prices

251458783.name: Bucerias Market & Beach
251458783.author: a TripAdvisor user
251458783.reviewBody: Quaint little town, usual alleys of souvenir stores no great deals same prices as everywhere else.\nThe beach was nice and sandy and very quite, but the waves were rough, Nice promenade to walk and sit on. Across the road market was being painted and spruced up for the season I guess. Half day for visit is plenty

651604157.name: We visit this street three or four times on our holiday!
651604157.author: a TripAdvisor user
651604157.reviewBody: I love visiting all of the art shops, fashion boutiques and cafes on this street. The art gallery always has a wide range of pieces and craft items to enjoy. Thursday Arts Walk is a lot of fun for all ages.

646157555.name: A Must Stop
646157555.author: a TripAdvisor user
646157555.reviewBody: This is a must stop on your stroll into the village.  There is something new every year and I am looking forward to a new acquisition.

553563550.name: Great Local Arts and Crafts
553563550.author: a TripAdvisor user
553563550.reviewBody:
We always drop by on a Thursday night. 
Bucerias, south of the kissing bridge has their weekly Art Walk from 7:00pm-9:00pm.
It is a nice way to view local arts and crafts.  Some galleries even offer you a free glass of wine while you view their art.
Over-all a nice way to pick up the local vibe.
Come out have some fun and support the local artists and crafters.
Make sure you drop into The Bucerias Art Gallery You will not be disappointed.
Dr.Rico
Canada

364962269.name: lots to choose from
364962269.author: a TripAdvisor user
364962269.reviewBody: this is a very nice shop - one of many along the road into the main flea market in Bucerias. There is something for everyone,

360924564.name: inspiring
360924564.author: a TripAdvisor user
360924564.reviewBody: lovely pictures very life like, interesting place to visit dont miss out on this experience you will love it

349790040.name: Unique!
349790040.author: a TripAdvisor user
349790040.reviewBody: Great place to visit if you love art!  Great deal of variety and plenty of help/discussion from artists/owners of gallery.

344157309.name: Nice little walk through
344157309.author: a TripAdvisor user
344157309.reviewBody: Some very nice art, really nice atmosphere.  Peaceful walking through, not bothered by people to purchase anything.

268971777.name: Art Walk
268971777.author: a TripAdvisor user
268971777.reviewBody: After dinner we did the Art Walk which we really enjoyed.  Safe to walk around after dark and enjoy the art.

256841405.name: Great art. reasonable prices
256841405.author: a TripAdvisor user
256841405.reviewBody: Michael is the artist, Floydi Lou his wife and together they market his beautiful art. He also offers art classes upstairs from his studio. On the art walk Floydi Lou offers some special hospitality

256124218.name: Local artist shine
256124218.author: a TripAdvisor user
256124218.reviewBody: Lovely gallery in Bucerias.  Several local artists work are on display. The art work was well done and enjoyable to view.

564661162.name: Street vendors
564661162.author: a TripAdvisor user
564661162.reviewBody: This is like every other street mall where you get asked to by some junk by the locals. It is great fun as there are some bargains to be had and some unique items also. Work a stop and then go for a cold drink.

549582922.name: Little street mall
549582922.author: a TripAdvisor user
549582922.reviewBody: Some of the streets are filled with little stores selling Mexican clothes and goodies. I found a few clothes and art that I haven\'t seem around. It is just a little walk around the town

473716512.name: Like any other fair at PV
473716512.author: a TripAdvisor user
473716512.reviewBody: My family and I did most of the shopping during our trip to PV at Bucerias. Prices are fare. You find everything you can find anywhere else.

121426835.name: Nice work
121426835.author: a TripAdvisor user
121426835.reviewBody: Nice work Antonio,we will come back next year and buy more paintings.You should be selling in Canada.....definitely recommended

121286401.name: beatiful art
121286401.author: a TripAdvisor user
121286401.reviewBody: I bought a painting from Antonio,sweet person.He is an excellent artist, has mexican contemporary art ...you should see his studio if you are on vacations or if you live in Bucerias .It is located in front of the market,one block from the church.

120593047.name: Beautiful Art from an Interesting Guy
120593047.author: a TripAdvisor user
120593047.reviewBody: I was walking around the flea market if downtown Bucerias and saw from the corner of my eye some paintings hung on a wall in a building across the street. I stopped in to talk to the young man painting in the entrance and was amazed to learn that he was the artist. He explained that he had studied in the same school as Diego Rivera (don\'t remember the name) and that he has done exhibitions internationally, etc. Very interesting guy and wonderful paintings. He also said that he gives painting classes, although I didn\'t have time to take one on this trip. But I did buy a painting and will be back next time to see what new artistic concepts he has put to canvas.

659588482.name: Something special.
659588482.author: a TripAdvisor user
659588482.reviewBody: This little shop has beautiful custom designed one of a kind silver jewelry and much more. Designs for any age or taste and reasonably priced.

470410007.name: Great Art and Nice people
470410007.author: a TripAdvisor user
470410007.reviewBody: Wish we would have had more time but we will go back.  Great art and nice people to boot.  Amazing work.

356425894.name: Art and also Art Classes
356425894.author: a TripAdvisor user
356425894.reviewBody: I enjoyed my visit to this gallery during the Artwalk.  The owner is a talented artist and he also teaches art. I loved looking through all the artwork.  The owner is lovely to speak with.  I have a very talented granddaughter who loves to sketch.  She would love to attend one of the classes but they are booked months in advance.

347231949.name: Superb art
347231949.author: a TripAdvisor user
347231949.reviewBody: Charming little gallery in Bucerias. Art classes as well, but  you  must book weeks or months in advance. The owner  is a very nice guy and a very fine artist. The paintings are very fairly priced, and there very nice prints at a very low price. We own 3 of the paintings, and love them. Worth a visit.

333172852.name: Gift of art!
333172852.author: a TripAdvisor user
333172852.reviewBody: A gem of learning experience while on vacation, take some art lessons....book early with the master of shadow....just a short walk from the Decameron....and a lasting memory when you take home your art!!!!!

529989262.name: Possibly Closed
529989262.author: a TripAdvisor user
529989262.reviewBody: Tried to find this place when I was down, and I think I found a house that used to be it? Matched the map and the house looked like the picture. But it isn\'t marked as a business anymore.

331304632.name: Yearly 1953
331304632.author: a TripAdvisor user
331304632.reviewBody: Wow again in Bucerias  teguila pharmica tucked into between a pharmsey and a ice cream store   mucho fun!!! They\'ve got tequila you really can\'t find back home Canada or the u.s such as peanut butter passion fruit and like 20 other flavors this is a must place to see!!!

308362288.name: Tequila..... it makes me happy
308362288.author: a TripAdvisor user
308362288.reviewBody: This place is for anyone who wants to try and sample the different tequilas.  We also found it difficult to get in due to their opening times but it was well worth persisting.  A must to do whilst in Mexico.

277725586.name: Free Tequila...who wouldn\'t give it a 5
277725586.author: a TripAdvisor user
277725586.reviewBody: Truth be told i don\'t drink but my partner in crime that day does, so she got to sample mine and hers....she said there was one tequila in there that was fantastic, fantastically expensive, but fantastic nonetheless. Also check out the glass guns full of tequila, very interesting...the guys knew a lot about tequila and it\'s a great place to visit...just don\'t over sample.

266149970.name: Never could catch them open!!!
266149970.author: a TripAdvisor user
266149970.reviewBody: This was on our list of things to do in Bucerias.  We were very excited to visit the museum & try the samples.  We went by on a Wednesday, Thursday and a Monday.  All three days were between noon and 3 p.m.  Never could catch them open.  There was no signage telling us when they would be open.  Very disappointed.

246396398.name: great variety
246396398.author: a TripAdvisor user
246396398.reviewBody: Stopped in here, tried many different flavors I\'ve never had before.  They are very generous with the samples!  Even if you don\'t normally care for Tequila, there is some nice liquer-style ones.  Bought 3 for souveniers :)

235916013.name: Lots of choices for tequila drinkers!
235916013.author: a TripAdvisor user
235916013.reviewBody: You\'ve got to try the many different types of tequila. From the very high end special tequilas, to the tequila liqueurs.

666742979.name: Check it every other day
666742979.author: a TripAdvisor user
666742979.reviewBody: The Art Walk is almost Our daily look see to see what new art pieces have been added, the displyed talent and the \nFunky art pieces are a surprise every time We walk in which is every 2 days on Our walk from RDC to Bucerias, if\nYou like pastals or go wild with color it\'s there, refreshing every time, like an unexpected surprise

663829998.name: Walk high point
663829998.author: a TripAdvisor user
663829998.reviewBody: Such a variety of art. People in costumes and makeup performing. Various crafts and food stuffs for sale. Exciting.

660501462.name: A Great Way To Spend An Evening
660501462.author: a TripAdvisor user
660501462.reviewBody:
Pick up the Bucerias Vibe every Thursday night during tourist season. Walk the street and visit the galleries.  Time 7-9 pm.

Dr. Rico 
Canada
🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦🇨🇦

658783707.name: Engaging and Fun
658783707.author: a TripAdvisor user
658783707.reviewBody: A fun way to meet local artists !  Engage the artists and find out their backgrounds... very interesting and delightful.

657049828.name: art walk
657049828.author: a TripAdvisor user
657049828.reviewBody: fun to see and good stuff to buy for yourself and gifts all of the artists are there and happy to speak with you

656873272.name: Not just for walking
656873272.author: a TripAdvisor user
656873272.reviewBody: We were a day late, so the street was open to traffic, making picture taking tricky. Despite being simply chalk creations they held up very well. There was a variety of styles with quality ranging from good to outstanding.

656440066.name: Decent way to spend a Thursday evening.
656440066.author: a TripAdvisor user
656440066.reviewBody: While it was a nice night, the art was average in quality and not high in volume.  The organizers provide maps.  If you have nothing better to do on a Thursday. it is fine.   Some of the galleries will give you a shot.

656429344.name: Incredible Art
656429344.author: a TripAdvisor user
656429344.reviewBody: We saw amazing, intricate 3D chalk drawings on the pavement during the street party this year. But there is always something neat to see on this walk.

656362002.name: Great art work by the locals
656362002.author: a TripAdvisor user
656362002.reviewBody: Excellent art work but very expensive for us, beautiful walk through the town, if you love painting etc. this is a must

655718681.name: Pleasant, mostly local artist
655718681.author: a TripAdvisor user
655718681.reviewBody: A nice evening activity in Bucerias. Smaller than in neighboring PV, but with more local artists. We were lucky to find it combined with a small festival including street drawing artists, which gave it a lot more depth. A pleasant evening.

655011374.name: Amazing
655011374.author: a TripAdvisor user
655011374.reviewBody: Artists create huge paintings on the road for a few blocks.  Some are 3 dimentional and all are excellent.  It is something to see.

654371577.name: Small, but interesting
654371577.author: a TripAdvisor user
654371577.reviewBody: To see local artisan\'s work outside of the downtown open air market place (where everyone is pushing you to buy everything you see), this is the place to go.

651947944.name: What a wonderful experience!!!
651947944.author: a TripAdvisor user
651947944.reviewBody: Such beautiful work.  The artists are there to talk to.  Unbelievable work on display.   Local charities have booths that you can donate to as well as the artists themselves.

651919827.name: Stumbled onto this after dinner
651919827.author: a TripAdvisor user
651919827.reviewBody: Very pleasant but closes down at dark. A nice stroll on a cobble stone road. Enjoyed the exercise after dinner at Karens a place Restaurant.

651804073.name: Great Thursday Art Walk
651804073.author: a TripAdvisor user
651804073.reviewBody: So much fun to go in and out of the Art Galleries in the area.  Very interesting pieces of art work for every style, budget etc.

651353878.name: Artist walk
651353878.author: a TripAdvisor user
651353878.reviewBody: Took in this awesome venue it was great, the entertainment and the  artists chalk drawing beautiful 3D creations were amazing,

650976321.name: Chalk murals on the street
650976321.author: a TripAdvisor user
650976321.reviewBody: This, I think, is the second year of the event, where skilled artists draw on the street. For three days part of the street is closed to traffic and the artists create.  Many of the creations done, when photographed appear to be three dimensional.  The event is in Feb for three days.  Don\'t miss it if you\'re in Bucerias next February\n,

650768286.name: Fun time.  Lots of great artist.  You must see the work of Lazaro Cardenas at 62 B Bucerias.
650768286.author: a TripAdvisor user
650768286.reviewBody: Lazaro Cardenas\' paintings are great.  We purchased a painting of our grandaughter from him.  He was able to do the painting from just a photo of her.

648769869.name: Absolutely fantastic!
648769869.author: a TripAdvisor user
648769869.reviewBody:
We found out about the artwork by accident on a chance walk to the village via the beach.

Working art studios where you can meet and watch the artists working, galleries, shops, complimentary drinks and live music.

It's usually held on a Thursday evening 5-7pm.  

It's a great thing to do, is entirely free of charge, and there are great restaurants and bars on the street to finish off the evening perfectly.

646606491.name: "Relaxing end to the day"
646606491.author: a TripAdvisor user
646606491.reviewBody: Restaurants open at 5:00 Art Walk starts at 7:00 - we had a wonderful dining experience at Sandrina\'s then took a stroll through the art galleries.  Very nice and for sure a "relaxing way to end our day"

646483731.name: Art & cocktails - nice combination
646483731.author: a TripAdvisor user
646483731.reviewBody: We enjoyed our recent Bucerias Art Walk and visited several galleries in the city.   The artists are all so friendly and much of their work is stunning.  So much talent in a small city!  Recommend as a nice way to spend a couple of hours.

636929662.name: A bit disappointed
636929662.author: a TripAdvisor user
636929662.reviewBody: My husband and I love art walks and expected this one to be similar to the ones we\'ve been before with all sorts of vendors and artists. I did some research and reviews were excellent. Perhaps it was misinformation, but when you search Bucerias Art Walk, it says it\'s located at 62 Lazaro Cardenas and is from 7-9 pm. We were walking all over the city during the day anticipating the Art Walk at 7 pm but was disappointed when we went in. It was very small and had only 5 artists displaying their art work (all beautiful) and a few food vendors but that was it. We were hoping it was a lot more especially coming in from an isolated resort costing us 420 pesos to get back when we could have skipped it and went back by local bus for 16 pesos. We did spend time in and around the art areas but unless you happen to already stay in Bucerias, definately take a peek but if coming out of town, we don\'t think it was worth waiting until late evening to attend this.

635228559.name: Nice gear
635228559.author: a TripAdvisor user
635228559.reviewBody: Lovely place and goods to explore, spending time looking at cultural pieces, really nice place to visit.

633991341.name: Nice walk
633991341.author: a TripAdvisor user
633991341.reviewBody: I visit this place with my wife in October, it\'s small but colorful and friendly, an excellent place to buy souvenirs

631651140.name: Beautiful artwork
631651140.author: a TripAdvisor user
631651140.reviewBody: If in the area, this is certainly something everyone should do, talented artist and beautiful artwork.

631038362.name: My first Art Gallery
631038362.author: a TripAdvisor user
631038362.reviewBody:
Wondering around then seen The Art Walk entrance.
Hidden away but opens up after walking through entrance.
Not being an artsy person can not compare  to other galleries.
Liked the "one line sayings" posted around the courtyard...LIFE IS HARD ..ART IS HARDER ..for example.
Able to look at a couple paintings that were not finished and the huge pile of paints ..brushes..etc...tools of the trade ..
Serval painting dotting the walls and courtyard.
Worth a look since it is in a convenient location ,located just a block from the beach and nestled among several pubs and restaurants. 
My first impression ..worth a look and a bit of your time..

626788090.name: talented
626788090.author: a TripAdvisor user
626788090.reviewBody: Very nice with lots of talent. Wish I had more room in my suitcase. Loved the tile work and paintings.

577465174.name: Great art of all sorts
577465174.author: a TripAdvisor user
577465174.reviewBody: A nice way to spend an hour. Local artist of all kinds display their works.\nReally nice atmosphere. We bought earrings in one of the shops.

576922688.name: Something to look at on the way to town
576922688.author: a TripAdvisor user
576922688.reviewBody: There are art and other shops along the way as you walk to Bucerias,everything from local hats and trinkets to expensive art and jewelry.It has something for everyone and if you are not in the market to buy its a nice distraction on the way to town

575313888.name: What a wonderful evening!
575313888.author: a TripAdvisor user
575313888.reviewBody: First we had dinner at Karen\'s and then we walked up a block to the Art Walk and I so wish we had skipped dinner so we had more time to experience all the beautiful art and music! Live music in the street and in the restaurants. This place is so alive with tourists, locals and artists of all kinds! Any art you want, it\'s here! And those huge canvases with big, wide, longing eyes looking back at you - so evoking of emotions. Pottery, crafts, painting, ceramic tile art - everything. It was evening so the lights were strung along the street made it even more magical, it was just such a fabulous experience!

573283138.name: Some very interesting designs
573283138.author: a TripAdvisor user
573283138.reviewBody:
Wednesday morning 11th April and we visited the town of Bucerias. One thing that Bucerias has plenty of is art, craft, and, jewellery crafted furniture galleries/ boutiques and stores.

While walikg about and browsing we picked up a map which gave the locations of a number of galleries etc, 14 in total, all in close proximity to each other.

We did see an array of Mexican arts and crafts, ranging from textiles, paintings, glassware, furniture , jewellery, portrait, mosaics and much more. The were painting and mosaic school.

There were some magnificent pieces of Mexican arts and crafts to see and buy there was also some less interesting things.

We did enjoy our walk about and were impressed with some of the designs and colours.

Every Thursday evening between 19.00 and 21.00 the is the Bucerias Art Walk.

571361467.name: pretty cool, it is worth the walk
571361467.author: a TripAdvisor user
571361467.reviewBody: You can chill while walking this area, people are nice and there is a lot to see. You can a couple of hours to appreciating the art scene.

568963861.name: Relaxing walk
568963861.author: a TripAdvisor user
568963861.reviewBody: Very nice relaxing walk in the evening, looking to find the perfect gift to take home.\nDo not miss it!

568192651.name: Beautiful
568192651.author: a TripAdvisor user
568192651.reviewBody: enjoyed our time taking in the beautiful sites of bucerias while enjoying the extremely talented artist that sold and displayed their unique pieces of art.

564736927.name: Small but friendly art walk in Bucerias
564736927.author: a TripAdvisor user
564736927.reviewBody: The Thursday evening (5 - 8 pm) art walk is a convenient time to get out and see the various galleries and shops on the main street (Lazaro Cardenas) in Bucerias.  There are a few street musicians which add to the ambiance, and many galleries offer a glass of wine.  The number of galleries is small (less than a dozen) but a nice range of work is displayed.  Worth a visit and the price (free) is right!

562505748.name: Very Interesting Art and Sculptures
562505748.author: a TripAdvisor user
562505748.reviewBody: This is a very enjoyable Thursday evening experience, between 7pm-9pm.\nSome of the artwork is very reasonably priced.and can be rolled for air travel.

561100915.name: One of the best area presentations!
561100915.author: a TripAdvisor user
561100915.reviewBody:
A ton of fun! Well organized! A great mix of artisans , cantinas,
restaurants and bars. Staff, owners and artisans were very
accommodating, informative, and complimentary as a 
community. Beverages and snacks were available.
Plan on enough time to roam and enjoy.

560151681.name: Beautiful Art
560151681.author: a TripAdvisor user
560151681.reviewBody: had a great time was one of the better nights out walking and looking at Art. Met a lot of people who had the same interests and listened to a few Art opinions which was great. Would go again for sure.

559889373.name: Fun to see something different\' than Mexican Junk at the markets
559889373.author: a TripAdvisor user
559889373.reviewBody: We went to the Bucerias Art Walk on a Thurs night. It is located on Lazaro Cardenas, South of the Main Plaza. There were 14 shops included. The map we picked up said it was from 7-9 but several of the shops were ready early and had drinks. Went to dinner at Sandrinas Restuarant then the shops. Was a nice night and bought a few things. Saw several more things I would\'ve liked to buy. Maybe next trip....

559620000.name: just stumbled into this
559620000.author: a TripAdvisor user
559620000.reviewBody: actually I had heard about this and then forgot about it ... but I\'m glad that I convinced my partner to walk through this with me. we didn\'t use a guide ... just wandered from place to place

559306243.name: A leisurely Thursday evening walk
559306243.author: a TripAdvisor user
559306243.reviewBody: It never ceases to amaze me the incredible talent found all over the world and this is no exception. If visiting Buscerias, this is a wonderful way to spend a few hours.

558433490.name: So many vendors
558433490.author: a TripAdvisor user
558433490.reviewBody: We went on Sunday and the place was packed. Bands playing, food vendors, and lots of art and handicrafts

558241779.name: Art walk
558241779.author: a TripAdvisor user
558241779.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this all the owners were very friendly offering nibbles and drinks and it meant they were all open

555676021.name: Art walk okay
555676021.author: a TripAdvisor user
555676021.reviewBody: The best thing I can say about this art walk is the lighted golf cart that picked us up from the first place art was offered to the next area some 400 meters away. We got two free drink tickets to Lupita, an amazing restaurant nearby, which seemed to be the main reason for the transportation. \nOverall, it was okay, not overly inspiring, but still fun. Drinks were offered free at many locations. Sort of a mini pub crawl art walk for drinkers. \nThere weren\u2019t that many locations and we were told it used to be much bigger. As I say, it was still entertaining and I got to visit with some of the very few cats in the town.

555281219.name: Nice Thursday Evening Stroll (& some advice)
555281219.author: a TripAdvisor user
555281219.reviewBody:
This was our second time on the Art Walk in about four years.  It's a pleasant evening diversion.  If this is your only stop in Bucerias and you don't want too late an evening, my advice is to arrive in the afternoon (3 pm-ish)  to catch the last hour of the market, then treat yourself to a massage on the beach or at Elements Day Spa, then enjoy a leisurely dinner in one of the many local restaurants,  and close off the evening with the Art Walk (7 - 9 pm).  

(You need to cross the bridge from the centre of town to find the stroll; be careful as the few steps up and down the bridge are somewhat uneven, and it can be quite dark).  

The Art Walk itself is comprised of several (not many) artisans / artists / merchants keeping their doors open in the evening, welcoming you to drop in, have a look, and say 'hi'. .  It can be quite social, depending on whether you connect with the work on display, with the artists, and/or with other ''art-walkers'.  On the night we visited, there was a live musician playing on the street, which added enormously to the atmosphere.

554238860.name: Not what it used to be.
554238860.author: a TripAdvisor user
554238860.reviewBody: We enjoyed the walk...made for a lovely evening.   The locals say its not what it used to be which is sad.   The potential is there.   The art displays are certainly worth checking out.   Bucerias is a cool little place regardless.

553787918.name: Fabulous Talent with No Sales Pressure
553787918.author: a TripAdvisor user
553787918.reviewBody: I loved walking along and seeing the amazing talent in Bucerias. There were a number of different mediums and nobody really tried to sell stuff. They would talk to me and tell me different things about the pieces but never any pressure to buy. Which was good because everything u wanted was too big to take home! Go and support the local artists and enjoy the evening! It\u2019s well worth the walk!

552608698.name: Wonderful finds
552608698.author: a TripAdvisor user
552608698.reviewBody: We love going to the Art Walk on a regular basis as we never know what we going to find!  Always lots of variety and great ideas for the house or souvenirs for loved ones!

552016958.name: Fantastic Opportunity to View the Work of Local Artists
552016958.author: a TripAdvisor user
552016958.reviewBody: We attended the Bucerias Art Walk between Christmas and New Years.  It was a great opportunity to meet local artists, view their work and stroll along Lazaro Cardenas in Bucerias.  It is a festive event and we met a number of people who are doing some amazing work in the community.  Christy and Nova were great in helping us to select some pieces for our home and we felt like part of the community there!  Highly recommend visiting and having dinner in the area.

550329391.name: First night fun
550329391.author: a TripAdvisor user
550329391.reviewBody: We arrived in Bucerias  on Thursday  and were happy to find it was Art Walk night.  We got to meet the author of a wonderful cook book and see many local artists works.

550244415.name: Enjoyable evening
550244415.author: a TripAdvisor user
550244415.reviewBody: A leisurely stroll from gallery to gallery, enjoying all of the amazing, talented artists. Stop along the way for a glass of wine.

544685648.name: A fun evening.
544685648.author: a TripAdvisor user
544685648.reviewBody: Casually walk from place to place. Fun to meet most of the artists and talk with the about their art - their creations. Makes a personal touch to something you might like. And, many of them serve a small drink.

543054580.name: walk and spend
543054580.author: a TripAdvisor user
543054580.reviewBody: Art walk was awesome. Seen a bunch of cool stuff. Some unique art. Problem is spent $ on some of the awesome art. If you go be prepared for something to catch your eye. If that is not a problem you\'ll love it. A real festive feel on the street when Art Walk is happening and at least one venue had live music provided free.

542900583.name: A great stop during a walk through Buscerias
542900583.author: a TripAdvisor user
542900583.reviewBody: This was a great place to see local artists at work. They were friendly and took the time to explain their craft and answer all the questions we had.  Worth a stop.

488725027.name: Interesting Art
488725027.author: a TripAdvisor user
488725027.reviewBody: The Art Walk is small, this is a quick diversion, but a good place to slow down for a few minutes and get out of the sun.  I found the art to be of good quite quality, interesting and thought provoking.

478976954.name: Strolling through on a hot day
478976954.author: a TripAdvisor user
478976954.reviewBody: Walked through her on a hot day. Panino`s is nearby so grab a treat and walk by. Nice collections of various art.

472236437.name: Great way to Spend Thursday Evening
472236437.author: a TripAdvisor user
472236437.reviewBody: Doing the art walk on Thursday evenings is a great way to see part of the town, art studios that are not open every day, meet and visit with artists and enjoy a drink at a bar along the walk.

471989963.name: A relaxing stroll
471989963.author: a TripAdvisor user
471989963.reviewBody: We had some trouble finding where to start, but were able to ask and get pointed in the right direction.  It was a pleasant evening.  We did not feel pressure to buy, but were able to just look.

471636690.name: I enjoyed it
471636690.author: a TripAdvisor user
471636690.reviewBody: So long as you enjoy art this is a good but short outing. Interesting pieces for sure. Its also a good way to get out from the sun during the heat of the day too!

470659608.name: It was ok...mixed bag of art
470659608.author: a TripAdvisor user
470659608.reviewBody: Mixed bag of art - some from local artists, some from people who\'ve landed in Bucerias.  Prices are a bit inflated in some stores, others not.  Again, a mixed bag!

470408027.name: Nice spot to take a stoll
470408027.author: a TripAdvisor user
470408027.reviewBody: Great place to look at the local art away from the souvenir shops.  Nice and cool plus just good art.

469758016.name: Great time
469758016.author: a TripAdvisor user
469758016.reviewBody: We have gone to this numerous times and have never been disappointed!! The people are friendly and the crowd is fantastic!!

468274775.name: okay
468274775.author: a TripAdvisor user
468274775.reviewBody: it was okay all though the art shops are open most days,\nthere was a lot of different art and i am sure they can help \nship

467958295.name: Lovely evening activity
467958295.author: a TripAdvisor user
467958295.reviewBody: Just returned from a two hour art walk in downtown Bucerias. The artists and galleries were very interesting. Some provided free cold drinks and cookies.  Along the way enjoy an Italian gelato!

467063025.name: Original art at reasonable prices
467063025.author: a TripAdvisor user
467063025.reviewBody: Fascinating art; worth a walk through! Some pieces are very reasonably priced, too. Friendly staff, too.

464159157.name: Good place for a visit
464159157.author: a TripAdvisor user
464159157.reviewBody: We stopped by and took in some local art. It was beautiful if a little small. It was worth stoping in and looking around. We\'ve been told there is a brilliant art walk festival on Thursdays at 7 which we would have loved to go see

463831933.name: Nice
463831933.author: a TripAdvisor user
463831933.reviewBody: The art walk has a lot of work from local talent. As you walk around you get to meet other people from different areas of the world.

463278597.name: Relaxing way to socialize with great art
463278597.author: a TripAdvisor user
463278597.reviewBody: The weekly Art Walk is an excellent way to take in the many galleries, many of which have finger food and adult beverages.  The artists and shop owners are always friendly.

461230366.name: Great experience
461230366.author: a TripAdvisor user
461230366.reviewBody: there are alot of very talented artists in this area. I highly recommend taking in the Art Walk - Thursdays 7 pm - 9 pm

461221535.name: Fabulous local talent!
461221535.author: a TripAdvisor user
461221535.reviewBody: Everything was beautiful in the shops.  The artists are all so talented.   Wish I had more $$$ and room in my suitcase!

460529038.name: art walk
460529038.author: a TripAdvisor user
460529038.reviewBody: A great was to see some local art and mingle with other travelers. Make sure you stop at Sol de Mexico from unique authentic jewellery made by Mexican artists.

459472843.name: Art appreciation heaven!
459472843.author: a TripAdvisor user
459472843.reviewBody: This is a magical evening walk along Lazaro Cardenas. All kinds of wonderful and exotic art and treasures to be found in the many diverse shops. Numerous restaurants with different kinds of food and entertainment, local arts and crafts and interesting sights to see. Not to be missed.

458959507.name: A quaint little stroll
458959507.author: a TripAdvisor user
458959507.reviewBody: During our visit, we reserved Thursday evening for the "Art Walk". It was our first time to do this. It was a still night with no breeze but otherwise a pleasant walk. Several of the " higher end " stores remain open and the streets and nooks have vendors of many sorts. Our friends bought some candy from a street cart. Some places set up outside tables ( as do food establishments each night ) to have a glass of wine. Sampling of a few wines was available. Jewelry and paintings seems to be the most common items for sale. There was hardly any solicitation by the vendors that night differing from walking through the markets on a daily basis. I would wander through the walk again. But I wasn\'t really walking through to buy. I mainly wanted to be exposed to the talents and flavor of the true artists. The ones that come from many places to live and work in Bucerias. The nights of walking through the streets is special in Bucerias.  Often families are home and their front door is open offering a glimpse of their lives we don\'t see in the day. Family sits outside on the side walk and children play. A great sampling of "local color" beyond the artist\'s paint brush.

458305922.name: Great Concept but a Paucity of Art Displays
458305922.author: a TripAdvisor user
458305922.reviewBody: The idea is neat and definitely worth a one time investigation but there are not many stores around to partake in the weekly event . \nAlso there does not seem to be much variance in the displays. iThe sample tasting is a nice touch but I am more interested in the event than the food. ,

457984188.name: Introducing you to some of their culture ,seeing it from the artist\'s point of view
457984188.author: a TripAdvisor user
457984188.reviewBody: This is one of my favourite things to do in this area, all the artists open up their spaces to the many visitors. Make a night of it and enjoy dinner as well. We have done this night for years  and still enjoy all the sites. It could be a family outing depending on your background and if the kids enjoy this kind of activity. I started taking my kids to shows ,galleries early so they would love this experience. It is not a place to play,but if the interest is there the walkabout breaks up the time too

456779860.name: Such a variety of art forms and artists.  Welcoming and fun
456779860.author: a TripAdvisor user
456779860.reviewBody: We went a couple times as there were lots of venues and artists to enjoy.  Book signings, talking with artists are the norm not exception.  Friendly visitors and lively walk.

455495273.name: Art Walk
455495273.author: a TripAdvisor user
455495273.reviewBody: A fun evening in the town with open galleries and tidbits to sample from many food sources. Friendly people and a fund experience.

454601733.name: March 2015 a great evening\'s culture :)
454601733.author: a TripAdvisor user
454601733.reviewBody: Not sure we saw everything there was to see, but it is always a treat to see original works on canvas, or sculpture, in a cultural setting.

454135209.name: Loved the art walk
454135209.author: a TripAdvisor user
454135209.reviewBody: It was a great evening walking around town! thank you! Stores are open late and serve nice drinks to share their wares!\n

453587966.name: A fun walk in town
453587966.author: a TripAdvisor user
453587966.reviewBody: We were in Bucerias, our first time and attended the Art Walk one night.  A very relaxed and fun time to see some beauritul pieces and meet their artists.

453234552.name: Lovely evening
453234552.author: a TripAdvisor user
453234552.reviewBody: Spent a nice evening walking the streets of Bucerias, popping into the shoppes, having appetizers looking at beautiful paintings, jewelry and sculptures. Great way to spend an evening.

452808378.name: Fun for an hour
452808378.author: a TripAdvisor user
452808378.reviewBody: Five of us did the Bucerias Art Walk before a late dinner and enjoyed ourselves.  Met the artists and shared some free mini-cocktails.  It was a nice way to spend an hour on a lovely, warm, relaxed night, although not everything was open.  Not for the serious high-end art collector but fun anyways.  Nice to meet some of the locals and learn something about the area and culture.

452620352.name: Great evening in Bucerias
452620352.author: a TripAdvisor user
452620352.reviewBody: Have dinner at Sandrina\'s, Karens Place, Marks Bar and Grill then stroll the town as many art shops will be open. We really enjoyed this and purchased many things to take home.

448706971.name: Nice diversion
448706971.author: a TripAdvisor user
448706971.reviewBody: The art walk was recommended to us by our hotel concierge.   After dinner at Sandrinas, we walked around the galleries for an hour. I wish we had scheduled an earlier dinner so that we would have had more time to explore.  The gallery owners were very welcoming and a lot of the art was very interesting and unique.  We found a set of 10 inch tall Mexican pewter candlesticks for only 240 pesos (around $12 USD).  Great souvenir from a very fun night. There was also a lot of interesting jewelry to look at and oil paintings.  Definitely worth exploring if you are in the area on a Thursday night.

446110222.name: Farmers markets-
446110222.author: a TripAdvisor user
446110222.reviewBody: Lots to see and do,especially enjoy options of 2 Sunday market, Tuesday market\nExcellent fresh seafood

444354026.name: A nice Thursday night stroll looking at  shops and galleries.
444354026.author: a TripAdvisor user
444354026.reviewBody:
If you  want to soak up some  of the Bucerias Vibe, then do The Bucerias Art Walk on a Thursday evening. The shops and art galleries will welcome you.  This is a no cost art tour  of Bucerias.
See you Thursday evening.
Dr. Rico
Canada

442675194.name: Thursday night
442675194.author: a TripAdvisor user
442675194.reviewBody: It is a nice way to kill a evening! Go for a nice walk and see some local art! No pressure on buying things they are just happy to have people there looking at there stuff!

441978706.name: Fun
441978706.author: a TripAdvisor user
441978706.reviewBody: Great art to view while visiting Bucerias. Local artists and others. Nice vibe on a non beach day. Well worth the visit if you enjoy art.

441643518.name: Quality art works for sale
441643518.author: a TripAdvisor user
441643518.reviewBody: We went on Thursday evening, strolled down the two or so blocks. We found some very special items and spent the rest of the evening figuring out with the store how to wrap pieces for travel back on our airplane. We are returning to complete the art walk a couple days later.

438843711.name: Thursday night fun
438843711.author: a TripAdvisor user
438843711.reviewBody: All the art stores stay open late, and many offer complementary snacks and drinks.  A wide variety of art in many styles and price ranges.  Don\'t forget to say \'hi\' to Jorge and Blanca at Casabor.

427396006.name: An easy and quiet  night out strolling the shops with plenty of art to see.
427396006.author: a TripAdvisor user
427396006.reviewBody: If you decide to head out for the evening, my recommendation is to have an earlier dinner reservation so that you have time to stroll the galleries and boutiques which remain open from 7pm to 9pm afterwards.

392597873.name: The boxer
392597873.author: a TripAdvisor user
392597873.reviewBody: What a great way too spend a couple of hours or more , if you are into the arts. Certainly different and educational pieces. You will find anything and everything.  From the wild too the extremely cultured. Must see when in Bucerias

381225636.name: Magical
381225636.author: a TripAdvisor user
381225636.reviewBody: Every Thursday night the Art Walk draws a large crowd. A chance for visitors to mingle with the locals as well as the artists and local business owners Everything from jewelry, clothing, art, food etc.\nIt is an event to check out while visiting the area.\nYou will not be disappointed with their warm welcome.

380714515.name: VERY ENJOYABLE EVENING
380714515.author: a TripAdvisor user
380714515.reviewBody: I HAVE EEN LIVING IN PUERTO VALLARTA FOR 17 YEARS. We enjoy driving out to the very warm and inviting art walk that is held monthly in bucerias in the winter months. bucerias is a very special town.

373940307.name: Nice area to stroll on a quiet afternoon
373940307.author: a TripAdvisor user
373940307.reviewBody: We bought some terrific local art and it was packaged correctly and made it easy to travel with and resonably priced.

373208400.name: Mrs
373208400.author: a TripAdvisor user
373208400.reviewBody: Beautiful. People very friendly. Weather was perfect. I would suggest  anyone to go there. There artwork is unbelievable. So many different things to choose from.

365869493.name: Must do in Bucerias
365869493.author: a TripAdvisor user
365869493.reviewBody: So many talented people, The Bucerias Art Walk is a beautiful finish to a wonderful day in paradise. You will see so much talent in one place, you won\'t believe you are in Mexico.

364158776.name: A Few Great Old-Mexico Craftsmen in Market
364158776.author: a TripAdvisor user
364158776.reviewBody: We drove over to Bucerias from the nearby Nuevo Vallarta hotel area to try and find some nice shopping. The local market in Bucerias is centered near the big cathedral in the old town square. It\'s a pretty straight forward walk along a few streets radiating out from the town square. Overall the market was not that special, there were many basic touristy things, not good quality BUT amidst the junk there were a few real hand woven tablecloths with heavy, lovely quality and colors - all pure cotton that will hold up for decades through washing. I was excited to find these among the polyester. \nAlso keep an eye peeled for the lovely heavy, hand-blown Mexico glassware; famous for its blue rim and green and blue stripes. Some of the stalls and stores sold this and wrapped it up beautifully to not get broken. Treasures to take home.

362032521.name: For our last night in Bucerias...
362032521.author: a TripAdvisor user
